Fry the salmon pieces, skin side first until golden and crispy on the outside and just cooked through, adding the garlic and ginger at about half way through cooking.;Place the mung beans spouts, red onion, coriander, spring onion, peanuts and cherry tomatoes into a bowl and pour over the dressing.;Divide the salad onto 4 plates and place a piece of salmon on top. Serve at room temperature.

ingredients: 1/2 cup flour;Salt to taste;3 Tbsp olive oil;3 Tbsp Mainland butter;1 onion, peeled and diced;1/2 cup celery, sliced;1/2 cup carrots, peeled and diced;8 cloves of garlic, peeled and sliced;2 cups Campbell’s Chicken Stock;2 tomatoes, chopped;zest of a lemon;zest of an orange;1/2 cup fresh parsley;Pepper to taste;2 bay leaves;4 good size lamb shanks
methods: Place the flour into a plastic bag and heavily season with salt and pepper. Throw the lamb shanks into the bag and shake to combine.;Heat a heavy based pan that has a tight fitting lid on a medium heat, when hot add the olive oil and then add the lamb shanks and brown on all sides. You need to get as much colour on the meat without burning. Set aside.;Return the pan to the heat and add the onions, celery, carrots, 6 cloves of garlic, peeled and sliced, bay leaves, 1/4 cup parsley, roughly chopped and season with salt and pepper. Cook until softened and translucent.;Turn your heat to high, add the wine and deglaze the pan. Add the lamb back to the pan along with the Campbell’s Stock and tomatoes and drizzle with the olive oil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer gently for at least 1 1/2 hours or until the meat is very tender. Remove the lid and cook for another 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened.;I love to serve this with plenty of gremolata over the top. Whizz zest of a lemon, zest of an orange, 2 cloves of garlic and 1/4 cup fresh parsley ingredients together in a blender then sprinkle a little of the mixture over each serving.

ingredients: 1 pork loin roast;Salt to season;Pepper to season;2 tsp fennel seeds, ground;3 cups pineapple juice;1 butternut pumpkin, skin cut off and cut into 2cm chunks;2 Tbsp maple syrup;5 Tbsp olive oil (split measure);6 rashers streaky bacon, diced;½ cup hazelnuts, roughly crushed;1½ Tbsp brown sugar;1 Tbsp cider vinegar;½ head red cabbage, thinly sliced;Juice of 1 lemon
methods: 1. Preheat an oven to 250°C. Pat the pork dry with paper towels then score the skin at 1cm intervals. Season with salt, pepper and ground fennel seeds and rub into the scored skin. Place into a roasting or Pyrex dish, skin-side up, and pour in the pineapple juice around the pork, so that it comes part way up the flesh but does not touch the skin. This will keep the skin as dry as possible and make the best crackling.;2. Roast in the oven for 20 to 25 minutes at 250°C so the skin starts to crackle. Then lower temperature to 160°C and roast for a further 50 minutes. While the pork is cooking, toss the butternut chunks with the maple syrup and 2 tablespoons of olive oil, then season with salt and pepper. Place in to roast with the pork when you turn the oven down to 160°C. After 50 minutes, remove butternut from the oven and roughly squash with a fork.;3. Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan and fry the bacon for 3 minutes, then add hazelnuts and fry for a couple more minutes. Top the roasted butternut with bacon, hazelnuts, and oils from the pan and roughly combine, then sprinkle over the brown sugar.;4. Remove the pork from the oven and set aside to rest. Return the butternut mix to the oven to bake at 180°C for 10 minutes, until the top has caramelized, then remove from the oven and set aside somewhere warm.;5. Remove the crackling from the pork and place under the grill for 5 to 10 minutes to finish off. Remove the pork from the juices and rest for 5 to 10 minutes before slicing. While the meat is resting, pour all the remaining pineapple and pork juices into a saucepan with the cider vinegar and boil rapidly for 10 minutes until reduced to a sauce consistency.;6. While the sauce is reducing, heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large frying pan or wok and add the cabbage. Stir-fry for five minutes, then add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.;7. To serve, make a small pile of cabbage on plate and mirror this with a small pile of butternut. Lay a slice of pork on top and spoon over the sauce.

ingredients: 1 Tbsp oil;1 Onion, diced;3cm knob ginger;2 garlic cloves;2 tsp cumin powder;2 tsp coriander powder;2 tsp ground chilli;1 tsp garam masala;3 Potatoes, diced and par-boiled;1/2 Cauliflower, cut into florets, blanched;1/2 tsp turmeric;salt to taste;1/4 cup coriander
methods: Heat oil in a large fry pan and add onions and gently fry until translucent.;Place the ginger and garlic into a mortar and pestle and grind until you get a paste. Then add the dry spices (except turmeric) and mix well.;Add the paste to the pan and fry gently until it froths. Add the potatoes and cover to cook.;When the Potatoes are nearly done add the cauliflower florets, turmeric & salt, gently combine. Cover to and cook for 2 minutes. Before serving mix through the coriander and check seasoning. Serve with naan bread.

ingredients: Spaghetti or other pasta - enough for the number of people you are serving;3 eggs + 2 egg yolks;½ cup freshly grated parmesan;½ tsp salt;Freshly ground black pepper;3-4 rashers of rindless bacon
methods: Cook pasta in plenty of hot salted water. While pasta cooks, combine eggs in a bowl and cook bacon in a deep pan. When pasta is cooked, drain and return to the pan with the cooked bacon in it. Remove from the heat.;Pour the egg mixture over the pasta and gently stir to combine. Finish with a generous grind of black pepper. Leave to stand for 1 minute.;Serve with grated parmesan and a sprinkle of parsley on top. Optional - add in herbs, garlic, peas and/or onion to create your favorite carbonara flavours.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons plain flour;500g beef, chuck steak, lean, raw;1 large onion;1 tablespoon Flora Buttery Spread;1 packet Continental Beef Stroganoff Recipe Base;2 medium potatoes, peeled, cubed;2 cups sliced mushrooms, Swiss brown or button;1 large carrot, peeled and sliced;1 can crushed tomaotes
methods: Preheat oven to 180°C. Evenly coast beef in flour. In a heavy pan, heat Flora Buttery Spread and fry onions until softened. Add beef and cook until well browned.;Place beef and onions in an ovenproof dish, wish mushrooms and potatoes, Continental Beef Stroganoff Recipe Base, 1¼ cup water, carrots and tomatoes.;Place in oven and cook for 1 hour, uncovered or until beef is tender.

ingredients: 2 Tablespoons butter;2 Tablespoons olive oil;1 onion, finely chopped;2 cloves garlic, finely chopped;2 Tablespoons fresh thyme leaves;zest of 1 lemon;12 rashers streaky bacon;6 Brussels Sprouts, halved, halves thinly sliced;salt;freshly ground black pepper;2 large skinned, boned chicken breast;500ml Campbells chicken stock;2 Tablespoon cornflour dissolved in 4 tablespoons cold water
methods: Preheat the oven to 200°C.;Heat the butter and oil over moderate heat in a small frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, thyme, zest and two rasher of the bacon thinly sliced. Fry gently without browning for 5 minutes until the onion is soft. Add the Brussels Sprouts and fry a further 3-4 minutes. Taste and season. Remove from the heat, cool and reserve. This is the stuffing.;Put the chicken on a clean surface, skin side down. Make slices into the thick part of the meat but not all the way through so that the chicken can open out into a larger flatter piece of meat.;Gently flatten with a meat hammer or rolling pin until the chicken is an even thickness.;For each breast, lay 5 of the remaining rashers of bacon side by side, but touching, on to a piece of glad wrap. Place the chicken, former skin side down on top.;Place half of stuffing in the middle of the chicken and roll up so you have a tight sausage shape wrapped in bacon. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes.;Remove the cling film and place chicken on oven tray, place in the oven for 20 minutes.;Remove from the oven, reserving the cooking juices.;Cover the chicken with tin foil and rest in a warm place while you prepare the sauce..;To make the sauce, pour the stock and reserved chicken juices into a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Add enough of the cornflour mixture to thicken lightly. Taste and season.;Slice the chicken thinly and drizzle sauce over top. Serve with mash and your favourite seasonal vegetables;Tips:;1. To wrap the chicken perfectly in the bacon; lay the bacon strips on some cling film, then roll and wrap.;2. When flattening the chicken place a piece of cling film over the top and tap gently.;3. For the stuffing, you can use what you hav

ingredients: 1 Tbsp dried yeast;½ tsp sugar;400g Homebrand high grade flour;100g fine semolina;1 tsp salt;75ml olive oil;2 onions, finely chopped;4 cloves garlic, finely chopped;2 x 400g cans crushed Italian tomatoes in juice;140g tomato paste, mixed with ½ cup hot water;salt to taste;freshly ground black pepper to taste;200g cherry tomatoes, halved;200g buffalo mozzarella, thinly sliced;parmesan for sprinkling;basil leaves
methods: Pizza Dough:;Put 250ml lukewarm water into a mixing bowl and add the yeast and sugar. Let it stand in a warm place until the yeast has dissolved and the mixture is frothy. Mix well.;Add the flour, semolina and salt. Mix well.Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic and place the dough in an olive-oiled bowl.;Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise until doubled in bulk. (Approx 40 minutes);Pizza Sauce:;Heat the oil over moderate heat and add the onions and garlic. Fry gently, without browning, for about 10 minutes until the onion is soft.;Add the tomatoes and tomato paste and mix well. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the mixture is thick and jam like in consistency.;Taste and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.;Pizza Margherita:;Preheat the oven to 220°C and place 2 pizza stones on separate shelves. Pizza stones help crisp up the base, but are not an essential utensil for this recipe. You can also use oven trays.;Roll the pizza dough out on a floured surface into 2 discs about 20cm in diameter. Spread 100ml of the tomato sauce onto each pizza base.;Sprinkle half the cherry tomatoes and half the mozzarella on each pizza. Sprinkle each with a little parmesan.;Slide each pizza onto a pizza stone or oven tray and place in the oven and cook for 10 minutes or until well cooked.;Remove from the oven, sprinkle with the fresh basil and serve.

ingredients: 1/2 cup soy sauce;2 tbsp brown sugar;1/2 tsp ground ginger;2 tbsp rice vinegar;3 cloves garlic;2 tbsp tomato sauce;1/4 tsp black pepper;1 kg Agria potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks;75 g Mainland butter;Perfect Italiano Parmesan cheese, grated;1/4 cup chopped fresh chives;100 g cream cheese;Salt to taste;4 1cm thick beef fillets.
methods: Teriyaki marinated beef fillet;For the marinade combine soy sauce, brown sugar, ground ginger, rice vinegar, tomato sauce in a shallow glass dish. Place the beef into the dish and drench with marinade. Place in the fridge for at least an hour (longer if possible) turning the meat over occasionally.;About 30 minutes before you start to cook, remove the marinating steaks from the fridge and allow them to warm up to room temperature. Reserve the marinade.;Light the BBQ and set on high. Lightly oil the grill or hot plate. Pat the steaks dry with a paper towel and place them onto the hot plate. Do not touch the steak for at least 3 minutes , turn and repeat the process. This will be cooked to rare. Remove and rest for 5 minutes before serving. While the steak is resting, heat the marinade in a small pot. Bring to the boil and simmer gently for a few minutes until it reaches a sauce consistency. Spoon the sauce over the steaks to serve.;Garlic mashed potatoes with cream cheese, Parmesan and chives.;Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Add potatoes and garlic; cook until tender but still firm. Drain and return the pan to the stove over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes. This will dry the potatoes out a little so your mash is light and fluffy.;Add butter, Parmesan cheese, chives and cream cheese, and then season with salt and pepper. Use a potato masher to mash everything together until smooth and creamy. Then it’s ready to serve.

ingredients: 2 Tbsp vegetable oil;4 Tbsp Thai red curry paste;700g sirloin or rump steak, sliced thinly across the grain of the meat, all fat and sinew trimmed of;150g green beans, blanched in boiling water for 2 minutes, drained, cooled and halved;½ cup Campbell’s beef stock;270g can coconut cream;3 Tbsp lime juice;1 Tbsp grated palm sugar or brown sugar;2 Tbsp fish sauce;handful of coriander sprigs;steamed rice for serving;sliced cucumber for serving;tomatoes for serving
methods: Heat the oil over moderate heat in a wok or frying pan. Add the curry paste and fry gently for 5 minutes.;Turn up the heat and add the sliced steak. Stir-fry until it just colours then add the beans and stock.;Bring to the boil, mix well and add the coconut cream, lime juice, fish sauce and sugar.;Mix well, taste and adjust the sweet, salty and sour flavours if necessary.;Serve on steamed rice with coriander sprigs and sliced tomatoes and cucumber.

ingredients: 1 Carrot grated;1 Red Capsicum, chopped;1 Egg, beaten;1 packet MAGGI Recipe Base Spaghetti Bolognese;600g Beef, Minced, lean;2tbsp Tomato Sauce;½ cup UNCLE TOBYS Rolled Oats;1 Red Onion, finely chopped
methods: Preheat oven to 180°C.;Combine the first 6 ingredients and press into loaf pan.;Combine sauce and oats and sprinkle over meatloaf;Bake for 45 minutes or until cooked through. Meatloaf will shrink from the sides of the pan.;Allow to rest for 5 minutes before turning out and slicing.;PREPARATION TIME:;10 minutes;COOKING TIME:;45 minutes

ingredients: 2 Tbsp vegetable oil;120g laksa paste or Brett’s curry paste (recipe available at youtube.com/countdownnz);4-6 Macro Free Range chicken thighs, skinned, boned, thinly sliced;4-8 prawns per person, raw, peeled;500ml coconut milk;2 Tbsp fish sauce;200g thin rice noodles;1 cup mung bean sprouts;1 cup fresh mint leaves;1 red chilli, thinly sliced;lime wedges for serving
methods: Heat a large saucepan over a low heat and add the oil. Add the laksa paste or Brett’s curry paste. Fry gently, stirring occasionally for 3 minutes or until fragrant. Add the chicken and mix well. Fry gently for 2 minutes.;Add the prawns, 375ml water, coconut milk and fish sauce. Mix and bring to the boil then simmer for 5 minutes or until the prawns are cooked. The liquid in the laksa will be soupy.;Drop the noddles into another saucepan of boiling water and cook for 3-4 minutes or as per pack instructions. Drain and divide evenly among 4 large bowls.;Add the chicken, prawns and soup evenly over the noodles and top with bean sprouts, mint and chilli. Serve with lime wedges.;Brett’s Curry Paste;Add 2-3 Tbsp chili flakes, 2 onions quartered, 3 cloves garlic, 1 Tbsp lemongrass paste, 1-2 Tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tsp shrimp paste, 4 Tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp turmeric and ½ tsp cloves to a food processor. Blend until you have a nice paste, adding extra oil to help loosen if necessary.

ingredients: 1 Tomato, cored and diced;2 tbsp Avocado Oil;1/2 Red Onion, finely chopped;Fresh Italian Parsley, fine chopped;4 pieces Salmon Fillet, boned;Zest and Juice of 1 Lemon & Lemon Wedges for squeezing;4 tsp Basil or Rocket Pesto;½ Red Capsicum, finely chopped;1 bunch Broccolini, thick ends of stalk cut off
methods: Pre-heat oven to 200°.;Put the tomato, onion, capsicum, zest, juice, parsley and oil into a large salad bowl, mix well.;Steam the broccolini until al dente. Remove. Reserve.;Put the salmon on an oiled ovenproof tray, fresh side up.;Spread one teaspoon of pesto.;Place in the oven for 10 minutes or until the slamon is just cooked through.;Remove from the oven and serve on the broccolini and salsa salad with lemon wedges on the sides

ingredients: 1.5kg piece beef corned silverside;30 whole cloves;4 Tbsp golden syrup;6–8 bay leaves;10-12 whole black peppercorns;2 oranges
methods: 1. Remove the meat from its wrapping and rinse under the tap. Trim away any visible fat.;2. Dress the meat with the cloves. 30 cloves should be enough to cover each side of the meat.;3. Take a large, deep saucepan and place the meat into the pan sitting the meat on a trivet if you have one, to ensure the meat cooks evenly.;4. Add the bay leaves, peppercorns and golden syrup.;5. Cut the oranges in half, squeeze the juice over the meat, place oranges into the pan.;6. Fill the saucepan with water; ensuring all of the meat is covered.;7. Place the lid on the pan and simmer until cooked, allowing 50 minutes cooking time per 500g.;8. Skim and clean the surface of the water with a ladle every 30 minutes or so to prevent the liquid from becoming cloudy. You may need to top up the pan with more water to keep the meat completely covered.;9. Once cooked, remove meat from the pan, cover and set aside for 12 – 15 minutes.;10. Remove the cloves from the meat and carve; slicing it across the grain. Serve with mustard sauce and seasonal vegetables.

ingredients: 2 avocados, peeled, stoned, sliced;5 Tbsp olive oil, plus extra for frying;250g cherry tomatoes;salt;freshly ground black pepper;1 onion, finely chopped;2 cloves garlic, finely chopped;large pinch chilli flakes;1 egg, beaten;600g beef mince;200ml aioli;6 hamburger buns, halved and toasted;handful of baby cos leaves;small handful coriander sprigs;6 short bamboo skewers;6 baby gherkins;6 pitted black olives;250g button mushrooms, thinly sliced
methods: Preheat the oven to 200°C.;Put 2 Tbsp of the oil and all but 6 of the cherry tomatoes in a small roasting pan. Season well, mix and place in the oven for 10 minutes or until the tomatoes are browned and collapsing. Remove from the oven, cool and set aside.;Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan over a moderate heat and add the onion, garlic, chilli and mushrooms. Fry gently for 10 minutes or until the onion and mushrooms are soft. Remove from the heat, cool and mix well with the egg and mince. Form the mixture into 6 even sized patties.;Panfry the patties in a little olive oil for about 4 minutes on each side or until well browned and cooked through.;To make one burger, spread some aioli on both halves of each bun. Place cos leaves, sliced avocado, roasted tomatoes, a cooked patty and coriander sprigs on the bottom half of the bun. Place the other half of the bun on top. Thread a cherry tomato, a gherkin and an olive on a skewer and push this through the bun to hold it in place while serving.;TIP:;Chill your patties in the fridge for 10-15 minutes before cooking - and they will keep their shape.

ingredients: 400g can Select diced tomatoes;1 large pinch chilli flakes;½ tsp paprika;1 clove garlic, finely chopped;1 cup white wine;1 tsp sugar;32 live mussels, well scrubbed and de-bearded;salt;freshly ground black pepper;3 Tbsp chopped parsley
methods: Put the tomatoes, chilli, paprika, garlic and sugar into a food processor and mix until blended. Set aside.;Put a large saucepan over moderate heat and add the wine. Bring to the boil and add the mussels. Cover and boil until the mussels open, removing them as they do, so they don’t overcook and become tough and chewy.;Add the reserved tomato mixture to the pan and boil until reduced and thick.;Add the mussels back to the saucepan and mix well, coating the mussels with sauce.;Taste and season with salt and pepper, but be careful with the salt as the mussels are already salty.;Serve in large bowls, sprinkled with parsley.

ingredients: 1 Onion, finely chopped;1/2 c Chicken Stock;6 Signature Range Alpine Sausages, sliced 3 cm;4 tbsp Olive Oil;4 tbsp Olive Oil;1 Large Head Broccoli;2 Red Capsicums, roasted, cored, seeded and sliced;400g Penne Pasta;Parmesan Cheese for sprinkling
methods: Heat the oil over moderate heat and add the onion and sausages.;Fry until everything is browned, the onion is soft and the sausages cooked.;Remove central stem from broccoli head, cut head into small florets,drop into boiling water, bring back to the boil, and boil for 2 minutes, drained well.;Cooked penne pasta until al dente or tender to the bite in plenty of well salted boiling water, drain well;Add the stock, capsicums, broccoli and hot penne, mix well and gently fry until everything is hot.;Season with salt and pepper and serve with plenty of freshly grated parmesan

ingredients: 200 mls Milk, hot;2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;330g Portabello Mushrooms, sliced;1 tbsp Fresh Thyme Leaves, chopped;250 mls Thick Beef Stock;2 tbsp Parsley, chopped;2 Spring Onions, thinly sliced;Salt;Black Pepper, freshly ground;4 tbsp Olive Oil;330g White Button Mushrooms, sliced;2 tbsp Butter;4 tbsp Chives, finely sliced;50 mls White Wine;800g Potatoes, floury;12 Beef Sausages
methods: Boil the potatoes in plenty of;boiling salted water until tender. Drain well, add milk and butter and mash well. Stir in chives, season and keep warm.;Heat 1 Tbsp of oil in a large frying pan and add the sausages.;Fry gently on low heat until sausages are cooked. Remove;from pan and keep warm.;Pour fat from the pan, add remaining oil, garlic, mushrooms;and thyme.;Fry over moderate heat until mushrooms are soft and browned. Add the wine, let it bubble, add stock and boil gently until it is slightly syrupy.;Stir in parsley and spring onions, taste and season.;Serve the sausages on the mash with mushroom gravy over top.

ingredients: 2 Vine Tomatoes;Salt to taste;Pepper to taste;2 x 400g pks Fresh Fettuccine;150g Hot Smoked Salmon Nuggets;Pasta Sauce;3 tbsp Olive Oil
methods: Preheat the oven to 190°C.;Gently wash the vine tomatoes and pat dry with a tea towel. Place on an oven tray and with a pair of scissors, cut each tomato into three equal portions. Drizzle with oil.;Season with salt and pepper and place in the oven for 10 minutes.;Meanwhile, fill the largest pot you have with water, add about a tablespoon of salt and a dessertspoon of oil. Bring to the boil.;In a medium saucepan, gently warm the salmon sauce.;Place the pasta into the boiling water, untangling as you go.;Simmer, uncovered, for 3 minutes and drain well. Place the pasta back into the cooking pot and add the warm salmon sauce and the hot;smoked salmon nuggets and gently stir.;Serve the pasta with the tomatoes.

ingredients: 1 bag Sealord Simply Natural Dory, thawed;1 small Onion;3-4 Garlic Cloves, crushed;Fresh Herbs (Coriander, Parsley & Basil);Pesto for garnish (optional);Cooked Pasta;1 can Seasoned Tomatoes, chopped;1 can Chick Peas;Olive Oil
methods: To prepare the sauce: heat a swirl of olive oil in a fry pan, add garlic and onion, heat over gentle heat. Sweat, do not fry, you want the onion to be translucent.;Add the tomatoes, chick peas or butter beans and some fresh herbs. Cook on a slow simmer for 5 minutes.;While the sauce is cooking - quickly grill the fish or cook in a hot pan with a splash of olive oil. Allow only a few minutes to cook the fish, it should be medium rare and just cooked.;To serve: place cooked pasta or rice on a serving bowl and ladle sauce on top, place grilled fish on top of the sauce and top the fish with some pesto or hummus, if desired.;Scatter some more fresh herbs on top for extra garnish.

ingredients: 16 Lamb Cutlets;2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1/2 tsp Black Pepper, freshly ground;1 Onion, finely chopped;Zest & Juice of 1 Lemon;130g bag Baby Spinach Leaves;1/2 cup Chicken Stock;Salt;Pepper;3 tbsp Mint Leaves, sliced;340g can Artichokes Hearts, drained & quartered;Steamed Rice to serve;1 tbsp Olive Oil
methods: Put lamb cutlets, garlic, 1/2 tsp pepper and 2 tsp oil into a bowl and mix well.;Leave to marinate 30 minutes then BBQ or pan fry without adding extra oil, over heat until just cooked through.;Remove from heat and rest in a warm place.;Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan and add onion, artichoke hearts and lemon zest, Fry gently until browned.;Add the spinach, chicken stock and any juices from the cutlets. Mix well and stirfry until the spinach is wilted.;Add the mint, and lemon juice, taste, season with salt and pepper and mix well.;Serve the cutlets on the spinach mixture with rice on the side and mint leaves and lemon wedges.

ingredients: 1 Small Red Onion, finely chopped;3 large Garlic Cloves, chopped;1/2 tsp Dried Crushed Red Pepper, Smoked Paprika or Fresh Chilli;2 x 410g cans Diced Tomatoes;4 tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped;2 tbsp Fresh Basil, chopped;1 pkt Sealord Simply Natural Dory Fillets, thawed and chopped into chunks;1 can Sealord Smoked Mussels, drained or Sealord Marinated Natural Mussels, drained;Salt to taste;Pepper to taste;250g Freshly Cooked Pasta;3 tbsp Olive Oil
methods: Heat oil in heavy large fry pan over medium heat. Add garlic, onion and dried red pepper/paprika/or chilli and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.;Mix in tomatoes with reserved juices, 2 tbsp parsley and basil.;Cover and cook for 15 minutes.;Uncover and simmer until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.;Add fish and simmer until fish pieces are just cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.;In the last few minutes, add well drained mussels.;Season to taste with salt and pepper.;Add pasta to sauce; toss to combine. Transfer to large bowl.;Garnish with remaining 2 tablespoons parsley.;*If you prefer you can add drained canned Sealord shrimp. Adding them to the mix at the same time as the mussels.

ingredients: 400 g Flaky Puff Pastry;200 g Bacon, rinds cut off;450 g Potatoes, peeled, cut into 2cm chunks, boiled until tender and well drained;Salt;Black Pepper, freshly ground;100 g Frozen Spinach, thawed, squeezed dry;9 Eggs & 1 Beaten Egg for brushing;Fresh salad to serve
methods: Heat oven to 200°C.;Divide the pastry into 2 equal pieces. Roll half the pastry out on a floured surface and line a 22 cm diameter by 5 cm deep, loose-bottomed flan tin.;Layer a third of the bacon on the pastry.;Add the potatoes, making sure they are evenly spaced.;Break 6 eggs and put each one in amongst the potatoes. Be careful not to break the yolks.;Layer another third of the bacon on top.;Tease out the spinach and place on top of the second layer of bacon.;Break the remaining 3 eggs on top of the spinach.;Finish with another layer of bacon.;Sprinkle with salt and pepper.;Roll out the remaining pastry and cover the pie, crimping the edges shut.;Brush with beaten egg, make a few slits in the top and place in the oven for 40 minutes or until well browned, puffed and well cooked.;Remove from the oven, cool a little then serve in wedges with;chutney and salad if desired.

ingredients: 2 x 525g pkt Sealord Simply Natural Hoki;1 sachet Green Curry Paste;½ c Plain Flour;1 Spring Onion, finely chopped;400ml Coconut Milk;Fresh Coriander for garnish;2 tbsp Oil
methods: Cut the frozen fish into chunks.;Sprinkle the flour over the fish and stir gently to coat the fish.;Cook the fish quickly in oil until just coloured, remove from pan.;Add curry paste to pan and cook for a few minutes and then add coconut milk.;Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes.;In the last three to five minutes of this cooking time, add fish. Garnish with fresh coriander

ingredients: 100g Butter;100g Butter;50g Flour (approx);50g Flour (approx);1 Onion finely diced;3 c Fish Stock or Milk;Freshly Chopped Parsley;1 sheet Flakey Pastry;Egg & Milk mix to brush on top;Salt to taste;Pepper to taste;Pepper to taste;1 c Peas or similar vegetable i.e. carrots or corn;1 pkt Sealord Simply Natural Tarakihi fillets chopped into chunks
methods: Pre heat oven to 180 degrees C.;Lightly sauté onion in butter, when slightly cooked add flour & mix, slowly add milk until a smooth sauce forms then add chopped parsley & vegetables of your choice.;Lightly toss fish fillets in some olive oil until just turning white.;Add the fish fillets to the sauce mixture and season with salt & pepper.;Roll pre rolled pastry to size of baking dish.;Place fish mixture in a baking dish, lightly brush edges with egg and milk mixture, place pastry on top and cut to size. Press down edges.;Place 4 knife holes on top of pie, brush with egg mixture.;Bake for approx 25mins or until pastry is golden brown.

ingredients: 360g homebrand spaghetti;100g salami;3 Tbsp olive oil;250g sundried tomatoes;juice and zest of 1 lemon;100 g baby spinach leaves;100g feta
methods: 1. Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil, add salt and cook the spaghetti until tender. Drain.;2. Place salami in a hot, dry, large frying pan for 4-5 minutes turning once until crisp or place a single layer of salami between two pieces of kitchen paper and microwave on high for about 1½ minutes until crisp.;3. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan, add sundried tomatoes and cook, stirring for 1 minute until heated through.;4. Add cooked spaghetti, lemon juice and zest, spinach leaves, salt and pepper to taste and toss over the heat for 1 minute.;5. Divide between 4 bowls and crumble over the crisp salami and feta.

ingredients: 2 Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, thinly sliced;3 tbsp Home Brand Taco Seasoning Mix;1 c Long Grain Rice, cooked;4 Spring Onions, finely sliced;½ c Fresh Coriander, chopped;2 tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped;Juice and Finely Grated Zest of 1 Lime;4 Home Brand Burrito Tortillas;3 Medium Tomatoes, finely diced;1 small Red Onion, finely chopped;1-2 Chillies, finely chopped;¼ c Home Brand Taco Sauce;country goodness sour cream lite;home brand olive oil extra light;home brand mushrooms sliced butter sauce;fresh produce purefresh avocado organic
methods: Sprinkle chicken breast with Home Brand taco seasoning mix.;Heat the oil in a frying pan and stir-fry the chicken with the mushrooms.;Combine the hot rice with the spring onions, half of the coriander, parsley, lime zest and sour cream.;Divide between 4 plates and top with the chicken.;Serve with guacamole and Home Brand burrito tortillas.;To make the guacamole, combine the avocado, tomatoes, red onions, chilli, coriander and lime juice in a bowl and stir through Home Brand Taco Sauce.

ingredients: ½ c Milk;½ c Milk;1 tbsp Butter;Salt;Pepper;Pepper;1tbsp Olive Oil;1 Onion, chopped;1 Clove Garlic, crushed;2 Carrots, chopped;1 pkt Continental Shepherds Pie Meal Base;1c Frozen Peas;500g Beef Mince;4 Large Mashing Potatoes;1 Stalk Celery, chopped
methods: Preheat the oven to 180¢ªC.;Cook the potatoes in boiling, salted water until they are soft.;Drain and mash them with the milk and butter.;Season to taste with salt and pepper.;Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat.;Add the onion, garlic and mince and cook for 5 minutes, stirring, or until the mince is brown.;Add the celery and carrot and cook for a further 3 minutes.;Add the recipe mix and 1 cup of water.;Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Remove from the heat and add the peas.;Place the mince into an 8-cup capacity oven dish. Top with the mashed potato and rough up the surface of the potato with a fork.;Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the potato is golden.

ingredients: 500g White Fish Fillets;1 tbsp Lemon Juice;1 Garlic Clove, finely diced;1 Onion, thinly sliced;3 -4 Tomatoes, seeded & diced;1 Zucchini, sliced (optional);Salt to taste;Pepper to taste;1/2 c Unsweetened Tomato Juice;1 c Kelloggs Special K;1/2 c Grated Tasty Cheese;1/2 tsp Brown Sugar
methods: Preheat ove to 180 degrees C;Remove skin from the fish (cut large fillets in half);Place in a shallow oven proof casserole dish.;Drizzle over lemon juice.;Top with garlic, onion, tomatoes and zuchinni.;Sprinkle with salt, pepper and sugar.;Pour over tomato juice.;Combine Kelloggs Special K and cheese.;Spread evenly over fish.;Bake in a moderate oven (180 degrees) for 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.;Serve with a green salad.

ingredients: 500g Chicken Tenderloins, diagonally cut into strips;2-3 tbsp (about 50g) Thai Green Curry Paste;140mL can Coconut Cream;1 c (250mL) Vitasoy Calci-Plus;225g can Sliced Bamboo Shoots, drained, rinsed;Steamed Jasmine Rice, to serve;125g Baby Corn;1 tbs Fish Sauce;1 tbs Vegetable Oil;100g snow peas;1/2 cup fresh Thai basil leaves
methods: Heat the oil in a wok.;Add the chicken and curry paste, and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly for 5 minutes or until seared all over.;Add the coconut cream, Vitasoy Calci-Plus and fish sauce and bring to the boil, stirring occasionally.;Add bamboo shoots and corn and cook for 5 minutes or until corn is just tender.;Remove from heat and stir in 100g snow peas and 1/2 cup fresh Thai basil leaves.;Serve with rice.

ingredients: 3 tbsp Fresh French Tarragon, chopped, also extra to garnish;1 tsp Dijon Mustard;4 Tegel Chicken Breasts, skin on;Salt, to taste;Pepper, to taste;1/2 c Dry White Wine;3/4 c Cream;3 tbsp Flour;75g Butter
methods: Cream the butter, tarragon and mustard.;Make a pocket between the skin and flesh of each chicken breast and place a spoonful of the butter in the pocket.;Reserve a little of the butter for cooking.;Dust the chicken with the combined flour, salt and pepper.;Melt the reserved butter in a non-stick, heavy pan and sauté the chicken breasts, until golden on all sides.;Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes.;Add the wine. Cover and continue cooking for another 15 minutes on low heat or until cooked.;Transfer the chicken to a platter and keep warm.;Gradually stir in the cream and simmer, until slightly;thickened. Return the chicken to the pan to heat through.;Serve garnished with fresh tarragon

ingredients: 3 Small Desiree Potatoes (about 350g), sliced;1 Red Onion, halved, thinly sliced;2 Bacon Rashers, rind trimmed, cut into strips;Salt;Freshly Ground Black Pepper;1 tbsp Fresh Oregano Leaves;1/2 C (125mL) Vitasoy Calci-Plus;Salad of rocket, Olives and Shaved Parmesan, to serve;Olives for Salad;1 Medium Red Capsicum, cut into 2cm strips;3 tbsp Olive Oil;6 Eggs;Parmesan for Salad
methods: Heat the oil in a large flameproof non-stick frypan over medium heat.;Add potatoes and capsicum, cover and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes.;Add the onion and bacon, cover and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes.;Season with salt and pepper and add oregano.;Preheat grill on medium.;Whisk the eggs and Vitasoy Calci-Plus together and pour into pan.;Cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until base is golden.;Cook under preheated grill for a further 5 minutes or until top is golden.;Set aside to cool slightly.;Slice the omelette and serve with the salad.

ingredients: 8 Chicken Thighs – boneless and skinless;8 Strips of Streaky Bacon;1 Small Onion, diced;3-4 tbsp Gregg’s Red Curry Paste – or to taste;Jasmine Rice;Fresh Mesclun Leaves or Green Beans to serve;2 Stalks Celery, diced;2 tins Chopped Whole Peeled Tomatoes;2 tbsp Olive Oil;Beans
methods: Pre-heat oven to 180 degrees.;Wrap bacon firmly around chicken thighs and arrange in a baking dish.;Heat oil and sauté diced onion and celery until soft, add Gregg’s red curry paste and cook 2 minutes.;Add tinned tomatoes and simmer 5 minutes.;Spoon red curry sauce around chicken thighs and bake 20-25 minutes until bacon is crispy and chicken cooked.;Serve on warmed plates with jasmine rice and fresh greens.

ingredients: 18 Baby Roma Tomatoes, halved;Salt;Freshly Ground Black Pepper;2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;150g Baby Spinach;2 c (500mL) Vitasoy Calci-Plus High Fibre;12 x 12cm Squares Fresh Lasagne, cooked;40g Baby Rocket;150g Goat’s Cheese, crumbled;1 Leek, halved lengthways, washed, thinly sliced;1/2 c (40g) Freshly Grated Parmesan;2 tbsp Plain Flour;40g Butter;1 tbsp Olive Oil, extra to drizzle
methods: Preheat oven to 150°C.;Place the tomatoes cut-side up on a baking tray.;Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil.;Bake for 50 minutes.;Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a frypan over medium-low heat.;Add the leek and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, until softened.;Add the spinach and cook for 2 minutes or until it just wilts.;Season with salt and pepper.;Melt the butter in a medium saucepan.;Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute.;Quickly whisk in the Vitasoy Calci-Plus High Fibre and continue whisking over the heat for 4 minutes or until the sauce comes to the boil and thickens.;Season with salt and pepper and stir through the parmesan.;To assemble the lasagne, place a lasagne square on each plate and spread the spinach mixture over each.;Top with another lasagne square, then the rocket and tomatoes.;Place a final lasagne square on top. Drizzle generously with the Vitasoy Calci-Plus High Fibre sauce and sprinkle with goat’s cheese.;Note: If baby roma tomatoes are unavailable, use cherry tomatoes instead.

ingredients: 450 gms White Fish;3 tsp Greggs Green Curry Paste;1 tbsp Sweet Chilli Sauce;1 tbsp Coriander, chopped;1 Spring Onion, chopped;1 tbsp Flour;2 Eggs;100g beans, sliced
methods: In the food processor whiz the white fish until well minced,transfer to a bowl and eggs,Gregg’s green curry paste,;flour, sweet chilli sauce,chopped spring onion and chopped coriander.;Shape into cakes with a little breadcrumbs.;Fry in oil until golden and cooked through.;Serve with avocado & sweet chilli dip.;Garnish with limes for squeezing.

ingredients: 2 Pork Fillets;3 tsp Greggs Red Curry Paste;1 tsp Greggs Crushed Ginger;Coloured Peppers;Red Onion;Zucchini;Skewers for Kebabs;2 tbsp Olive Oil;2 tbsp Honey;2 tbsp Honey
methods: Cut 2 pork fillets into bite sized pieces and marinate in 3 teaspoons of Gregg’s red curry paste, 1 tablespoon of honey, 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 teaspoon of crushed ginger. Alternate pieces of summer vegetables -coloured peppers, red onion and zucchini on pre-soaked skewers. Bbq or grill until meat is cooked and vegetables tender. Serve with cucumber, mint and yoghurt salsa.;Makes 12-14 skewers

ingredients: Fresh Green Beans;1kg Chicken Breast;Greggs Garlic & Basil Paste;Fresh Salad Leaves;Cherry Tomatoes;Diced Feta;Olive Oil
methods: Marinate chicken breasts in Gregg’s basil & garlic paste and cook on the bbq or grill.;Arrange fresh salad leaves, blanched green beans and cherry tomatoes on a serving platter and top with warm sliced chicken breast.;Finish with diced feta and a dressing of olive oil and a teaspoon of Gregg’s basil & garlic paste.

ingredients: 1 tbsp Cornflour;1 tsp Cinnamon;1 tsp Sesame Oil;1c Plum Sauce;1c Red Wine plus 1 Tbsp Red Wine;500g Leg or Shoulder NZ Pork Steaks, diced;1 tbsp Brown Sugar;1 tbsp Soy Sauce;1 tsp Minced Garlic;1 tsp Olive Oil
methods: Mix the brown sugar, 1 tbsp red wine, soy sauce, cornflour, oil, cinnamon and garlic together in a bowl.;Add the Trim Pork, toss to coat in the marinade, cover and refrigerate for about 1 hour.;Preheat the oven to 170°C.;Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan. Remove the pork from marinade and add to pan. Stir-fry until brown. Transfer to a casserole dish.;Add reserved marinade, plum sauce and red wine to pan. Bring to the boil, then pour over pork.;Cover the casserole and place in preheated oven.;Cook for 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours or until the pork is tender. Serve with wild rice and steamed vegetables.;Tip: Make sure the pieces of pork are approximately the;same size so they cook evenly.

ingredients: 1 Tbsp Greggs Garlic & Basil Paste;1 Slice Proscuitto, Pancetta or Streaky Bacon;1 Tbsp Pinenuts - Roasted & Ground;1 Chicken Breast;Parmesan Shavings
methods: Slice through centre of chicken breast horizontally (but not the whole way through, opening out to a large flat piece of chicken).;Fill with Gregg’s Basil & Garlic Paste, shaved Parmesan, ground pinenuts and slice of proscuitto.;Fold chicken over and hold down with toothpick.;Place in foil envelope and bake for 30-40 minutes at 180°C.

ingredients: 4 Eye Fillet Steaks;gourmet garden coriander paste, 80g tube;just garlic garlic crushed, 185g;4 slices Traditional Bread;Mayonnaise;Buttercrunch Greens;Vine Tomatoes;Creamy Brie Cheese
methods: Brush beef fillet slices with coriander & garlic paste.;Sear or bbq grill to medium rare.;Toast sourdough slices and spread with combined mayonnaise and a teaspoon of coriander & garlic paste.;Layer beef sandwiches with buttercrunch greens, vine tomatoes and creamy Brie cheese.

ingredients: 2 Onions, finely chopped;3 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1/2 c Kalamata Olives, pitted;8 Sundried Tomatoes, sliced;2 tbsp Chopped Parsley;6 Sheets Signature Range Ready Rolled Flaky Pastry;Salt;Pepper;600g Premium Beef Mince;1 Egg, beaten;1/2 c Frozen Peas;1/2 c Frozen Peas;2 tbsp Select Olive Oil;4 Rashers Rindless Bacon, diced
methods: Preheat the oven to 200°C;Heat the oil over moderate heat and add the onions and garlic.;Fry gently for about 5 minutes until the onions are soft.;Remove from the heat and cool.;Put everything except the pastry and egg into a bowl and mix well.;Divide into 6 equal portions.;Cut a 22 cm diameter disc out of each sheet of pastry.;To make one pasty; brush the edge of a pastry disc with egg, form a portion of the filling into a sausage shape, put it into the middle of the disc and bring the edges up together and crimp closed.;Repeat for the other 5. Brush the pasties with egg and place on a baking tray.;Bake 25-30 minutes until well cooked.;Serve with your favourite tomato salsa or sauce, and salad.

ingredients: 750g packet Wattie's Frozen Recipe Mix Winter Vegies;1/2 Loaf French Bread, sliced;Garlic Butter for spreading;1/2 c Lite Cream, Lite Sour Cream or Lite Creme Fraiche;400g can Wattie's Cheese and Onion Vegetable Bake Sauce;2 tbsp Wholeseed Mustard whole;250-400 g smoked fish, flaked
methods: Place the Wattie’s Frozen Recipe Mix Winter Vegies into a large bowl, cover and microwave on high power 100% for 5-6 minutes or until defrosted.;Add the flaked smoked fish, Wattie’s Cheese and Onion Vegetable Bake Sauce, lite cream and mustard and stir well. Transfer to a lasagne-style dish.;Spread the French bread slices with the garlic butter and layer on top of the smoked fish mixture.;Bake at 180ºC for 30 minutes or until hot and golden.

ingredients: 1 tbsp dried oregano;2 cloves garlic, finely chopped;1 tbsp olive oil;4 boned lamb leg steaks;salt to taste;freshly ground black pepper to taste;2 cups prepared instant cous cous;1/2 cup toasted pistachios or almonds, coarsely chopped;1/2 cup pitted green olives, coarsely chopped;zest of 1 lemon;1 cup thinly sliced mint leaves, plus extra leaves for serving
methods: Lamb Marinade;Mix together the oregano, garlic and oil in a bowl. Rub all over the lamb and season with salt and pepper.;Set aside to marinate for at least 20 minutes or overnight in the fridge. Allow the lamb to return to room temperature before cooking.;When ready to cook, place into a frying pan over a moderate heat. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side until well browned or cooked to your liking.;Remove the lamb steaks from the heat, cover and rest in a warm place.;Cous Cous;Cook the cous cous as directed on the packet.;Fluff up with a fork so there are no lumps and mix through all the remaining ingredients, seasoning with the salt and pepper to taste.;Serve the lamb on the cous cous with extra mint, parsley and coriander leaves sprinkled on top.

ingredients: 500 g 100% New Zealand Pork Pieces;1 Onion, peeled and chopped;1/2 tsp Cinnamon, ground;2-3 Firm Ripe Pears, peeled and cut into wedges;2 c Chicken Stock;2 tbsp Fresh Coriander, chopped;200g Packet Cous Cous;1 tsp Minced Garlic;1 tsp Minced Ginger;1 tsp Cumin seeds, whole;1/4 c Slivered Almonds, toasted;3 Dried Apricots, finely sliced
methods: Heat a dash of oil in a deep lidded frying pan, brown the 100% New Zealand Pork Pieces, set aside.;Cook the onion, garlic, ginger, cumin and cinnamon, until the onion is just beginning to soften. Add pears and chicken stock and return the pork to the pan. Cover and simmer very gently for 40 minutes or until tender.;In a small saucepan stir 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 cup boiling water and the Diamond Moroccan Cous-Cous flavour sachet and cous-cous. Stir quickly for 5 seconds. Remove from heat, cover and stand for 3 minutes. Add apricots and almonds, mix lightly with a fork.;Season the tagine with salt and pepper, stir in coriander. Serve with the cous cous.

ingredients: Fish Fillets;Garlic Paste;Lemon Zest;Breadcrumbs;Olive Oil
methods: Spread fresh fish fillets with coriander & garlic paste.;Place on a baking tray and top with lemon zest and fresh breadcrumbs, drizzle with olive oil and bake on medium for 10-12 minutes.;Serve with summer salad of julienne vegetables.

ingredients: 4 Lean Lamb Leg Steaks;2 tsp Lemon Rind, finely grated;2 tbsp Rosemary, freshly chopped;3 tbsp Basil Pesto;6 tbsp Sour Cream;600g Watties Vegetable Roasters;1/2 c Marinade
methods: Combine the Marinade with the lemon rind and rosemary and pour over the lamb. Turn to coat.;Cover and marinate for 30 minutes, at room temperature. Any longer, refrigerate.;Preheat the barbecue and cook the Wattie’s Vegetable Roasters Mediterranean on a well-oiled barbecue plate for 20 minutes turning often, until hot and cooked.;Cook the lamb over a medium heat on a well-oiled grill until thoroughly cooked, turning often to prevent burning, for about 10-15 minutes.;Combine the pesto and sour cream and serve with the barbecued lamb and vegetable roasters. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 tsp Flaky Sea Salt;8 Small Red Onions, peeled and halved;1 c Chicken Stock;1 tbsp Cornflour;1/2 c White Wine;2 tbsp Brown Sugar;2 tbsp Brown Sugar;2 tbsp Balsamic Vinegar;2 tbsp Olive Oil;2 Apples, peeled, cored and sliced thickly;Pork Shoulder Roast, bone in or boneless
methods: Preheat the oven to 180°C.;Put 1 tablespoon of the oil into a small roasting pan.;Lift the elastic net which covers the pork, slice the fat in parallel lines down to the flesh then replace the net.;Put pork into roasting pan. Make small incisions all over pork and push a slice of garlic into each. Put a sprig of rosemary on each side of the pork. Sprinkle the salt onto the fat on top of roast.;Place in oven for 2 hours and roast until well cooked.;In separate small roasting pan, put remaining oil, onions, apples, wine, balsamic and sugar. Mix well. Cover and place in oven and bake 1 hour.;Uncover and bake a further 15 minutes then remove from the oven and reserve.;When the pork is cooked, remove from oven, discard the rosemary, place pork on heatproof plate and keep warm.;Pour fat from pork pan and place the pan over moderate heat.;Add chicken stock, bring to boil and whisk in cornflour dissolved in 3 tablespoons cold water so it thickens slightly. Add onion mixture from the other pan, mix well, simmer one minute, taste and season with salt and pepper then remove from the heat.;Serve the pork, sliced, with the onion mixture on the side.;Good with mashed potatoes and salad.

ingredients: 200mls Coconut Cream;Few Drops Tabasco Sauce;4 Boneless Chicken Breasts;1 Carrot, cut into thin ribbons;4 Naan Breads, to serve;4 tbsp Crunchy Peanut Butter;Cucumber, peeled and sliced;1 Zucchini, cut into thin ribbons;Zest and Juice of 1 Lemon;2 tbsp Dry Roasted Peanuts, chopped;2 tsp Worcester Sauce;1 Red Capsicum, cut into thin ribbons;Bamboo Skewers soaked in water for 10 mins
methods: Mix together the coconut cream, peanut butter, Worcester and Tabasco sauces.;Add half of the lemon juice.;Cut the chicken into small chunks and thread onto bamboo skewers.;Spoon over a little satay sauce and leave to rest for 30 minutes.;Place marinated chicken onto a BBQ or hot grill. Cook for 2-3 minutes each side.;Heat remaining sauce until it boils, stirring continuously.;Heat the naan breads. BBQ or grill the vegetable ribbons.;Pour over the lemon juice and zest.;Arrange the satays on top of the naan and vegetables and pour the sauce alongside.

ingredients: 1 c Button Mushrooms;2 Tenderbeef Steaks eg: Rump;6 Frozen Corn Cobbs, thawed;Olive Oil to Brush;3 pkts Garlic Naan Bread;1 Red Onion, quartered;2 Chicken Breast Fillets;1 Green Capsicum, diced chunky;1 Jar Creamy Satay Sauce;1 Red Capsicum, diced chunky;12 Large Bamboo Skewers, soaked in water.;2 Zucchini, diced chunky
methods: Cube the steak and chicken, cut the corn cobs into 3 pieces.;Blanch the mushrooms in a pot of boiling water for 30 seconds, then refresh on cold water.;Drain well.;Skewer alternately the steak and vegetables and then the chicken and vegetables, to give you 6 beef and 6 chicken shaslicks.;Brush with oil, then barbecue or grill for 2-3 minutes for the beef, 4-5 minutes for the chicken, turning occasionally.;Heat the satay sauce in a pot on the BBQ or cook-top.;BBQ or microwave the naan bread for 1 minute.;Place shaslicks onto naan bread, drizzle over satay sauce, serve.

ingredients: fresh produce coriander living plant, each;425g can Craig's Chilli Beans;1 Onion, peeled and chopped;1/2 c Couscous;1/2 c Chopped Fresh Coriander or Parsley;1 tsp Baking Soda;5 Medium Plain Pita Bread;1/2 Cos Lettuce, trim off coarse leaves & washed;1/2 Red Onion, peeled and sliced;1/4 Telegraph Cucumber;1 tsp Minced Garlic;3/4 c ETA Mayonnaise;2-3 Tomatoes, cut into wedges;2 tbsp Chopped Fresh Mint
methods: Pulse Craig’s Chilli Beans, onion and garlic in a food processor, until roughly chopped.;Turn into a bowl, sprinkle with couscous, mix well, cover with cling film and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or until the mixture is firm to touch.;Add the coriander, baking soda and season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Roll into balls and flatten slightly.;Heat a little oil in a large frying pan and cook the Falafels for 2-3 minutes on each side until crisp and golden.;Combine ETA Smooth and Creamy Mayonnaise with the mint.;Serve the Falafels with salad in pita breads topped with minty mayonnaise

ingredients: 2 tsp Garlic, cruched plus 1 tsp for Vegetables;25g Butter Melted;2 tbsp Chopped Parsley;Salt;Freshly Ground Black Pepper;Olive Oil;800g - 1kg Floury Potatoes;2 tsp Mustard;4 Spring Onions, finely chopped;1/4 c Milk;2 tbsp Soya Sauce;2 tbsp Demerara Sugar;1/4 Green Cabbage Shredded;Juice and Zest of 1 Orange;4 Tenderbeef Porterhouse or Scotch Fillet Steaks
methods: Mix all the marinade ingredients ( orange, soya sauce, sugar, mustard, 2 tsp garlic ) in a non-metallic dish and add the steaks. Cover and chill until required, turning to coat well.;Meanwhile, cook the potatoes until tender, then mash until fluffy with the butter and milk. Place the cabbage, onion, garlic and oil into a pan.;Saute while stirring for around 3 minutes until tender. Mix in the mashed potato, parsley, salt and pepper.;Place steaks onto a grill tray and cook under medium-high for 3-4 minutes each side, basting at times with marinade.;Spoon the potato into an oiled ovenproof dish.;Grill until golden and serve alongside the sticky steak.

ingredients: 3 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1 Red Onion, diced;3 Courgettes, thinly sliced;1/2 c Black Greek Olives;Salt;Pepper;2 tbsp Parsley, chopped;1/2 c Dry White Wine;4 Tomatoes, diced;1 Red Capsicum, cored, seeded and thinly sliced;1 Yellow Capsicum, cored, seeded and thinly sliced;300g Penne or other short pasta;4 tbsp la espanola olive oil;500g Chicken Stir Fry
methods: Cook pasta until al dente in plenty of well salted water, drained and ready when the chicken is ready;Heat the oil over high heat and add the chicken and garlic.;Stirfry over high heat until well browned.;Add the onion, courgettes, capsicums and olives and stirfry, 5 minutes or until the onion is soft.;Add the wine and tomatoes, mix well and bring to the boil.;Season with salt and pepper and serve the chicken mixture over the hot pasta with parsley on top.

ingredients: 1/3 C each: Couscous, Boiling Water;1/4 C Pitted Prunes, chopped;100g Dried Mixed Peel, chopped;1 tsp Thyme;1 tsp Ground Cumin;1/2 tsp Ground Turmeric;1/2 tsp Ground Cinnamon;1/4 C Signature Range Orange Juice;1 Egg, lightly beaten;1 Size 16 Chicken, thawed;1/4 C Dried Apricots, chopped;Olive oil spray;4 tbsp Dukkah
methods: Place the couscous in a large bowl. Cover with boiling water and stand for 5 minutes to;allow couscous to absorb the water.;Stir in all other stuffing ingredients.;Using a paper towel, pat dry neck and body cavities of chicken. Lightly fill with stuffing. Secure body opening with skewers and tie or truss the legs.;Fold neck flap back over neck opening and secure with skewer.;Preheat oven to 160°C. Lightly spray a roasting pan with oil.;Place chicken, breast-side up, in pan. Lightly spray with oil. Cover with an oven bag.;Roast for 2 hours or until cooked.;Char-grilled capsicum, steamed fennel and a crisp green salad are excellent accompaniments.

ingredients: 2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1/2 tsp Salt;1/2 c Parsley, chopped;1 1/2 c Chicken Stock & 1/2 C Water;1 handful Spinach Leaves;3 tbsp Olive Oil;2 Eggs;1/2 c Ham, diced;1/2 c Breadcrumbs;Brown Brothers Red Everton;Juice & Zest of 1 Large Lemon;500g Prime Beef Mince;1/2 c Parmesan Cheese, finely grated
methods: Put the mince, breadcrumbs, parmesan, eggs, garlic, salt and the 1/2 cup parsley into a food processor and process until smooth and well mixed.;Remove to a bowl and mix in the ham well. Shape into 20 small meatballs and dust them well with flour. Heat the oil over moderate heat and brown the meatballs. Add the zest, juice, stock and water and bring to the boil.;Boil gently for 5 minutes or until the meatballs are cooked and the liquid has reduced a little. Add the spinach and let it wilt. Serve with rice and sprinkle with parsley.

ingredients: 500g Diced Chicken;1 tbsp Greggs Green Curry Paste;400ml Coconut Cream;Fresh Lime to taste;2 tbsp Brown Sugar;400g Frozen or Fresh Chopped Vegetables
methods: For a tasty Thai-style curry heat oil in a wok or frying pan.;Add Gregg’s Green Curry Paste and chicken and cook for 5 minutes. (Chicken can be substituted for beef, pork or seafood if you prefer).;Stir through some sliced vegetables then add coconut cream and 2 tablespoon’s brown sugar. Simmer until meat is cooked through.;Top with fresh sliced chillies and a splash of lime. Serve with rice.

ingredients: 2 Chicken Breasts, whole skinned and boned;2 tbsp Avocado Oil;4 Garlic Cloves, crushed;1/2 C Sundried or Semi-dried Tomates;1/4 C Dry White Wine;3/4 C Chicken Stock;1/4 C Cream
methods: Halve the chicken breasts. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan. Cook the chicken on medium heat until golden on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Cover loosely halfway through cooking. Remove to one side.;Add the garlic and sundried tomatoes to the pan and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the wine and chicken stock and simmer for 4-5 minutes. Purée then add the cream.;Return the chicken to the pan. Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until cooked.;Transfer the chicken to a serving plate and keep warm.;The chicken can be served garnished with capers and/or basil.

ingredients: 500g Diced Chicken;50g Butter;2 Cloves Garlic, crushed;1 tsp Tumeric;1 tsp Cumin;1 tsp Ground Nutmeg;1/2 tsp each Salt and Pepper;2 Tbsp Tomato Paste;1/2 tsp Garam Masala;1 Onion, chopped;Black Pepper;1/2 Cup Cream;1 tsp Chilli Seasoning
methods: Mix together all the spices (except garam masala) and toss through the chicken. Melt the butter in a saute pan. Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft. Add the chicken.;Stir until golden. Add the tomato paste, garam masala. Stir in the cream. Season and simmer for 5-8 minutes until rich and creamy. Then simply enjoy!

ingredients: 2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;Black Pepper, freshly ground;Salt;3 tbsp Chives, finely chopped;3 tbsp Parsley, finely chopped;4 pieces sirloin steak about 150-200g each;4 tbsp Balsamic Vinegar;Brown Brothers Shiraz;200g Button Mushrooms, sliced;6 tbsp Olive Oil
methods: Heat 3 tablespoons of the oil over moderate heat and add the onions, garlic, mushrooms and vinegar.;Gently fry for about 15 minutes until the onion and mushrooms are soft and the vinegar has evaporated.;Season to taste with salt and pepper and stir in the chives and parsley, keep warm and reserve.;Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan, add the steak and panfry it to your liking.;Serve the onions and mushrooms on the steak.

ingredients: 1 Garlic Clove, finely chopped;1/2 tsp Salt;1/2 tsp Black Pepper, freshly ground;3 tsp Parsley, chopped;600g Premium Beef Mince;1/2 c Parmesan Cheese, grated
methods: Mix everything well, divide into 6 portions and flatten into 6 patties 2cm thick by 10cm in diameter. Panfry in a little olive oil or barbecue over moderate heat until completely cooked. Serve in warm pita breads or sesame buns with sliced tomatoes, cucumber, lettuce leaves or your favourite;hamburger fillings.

ingredients: 1 tbsp Tabasco Sauce;Salt;4 tbsp Corn Kernals;1 Onion, quartered;1 Garlic Clove, crushed;1 tbsp Parsley;32 Small/Baby Onions;1 tbsp Ground Coriander;3 tbsp Olive Oil;4 tbsp Stirfry Sauce;500g Tenderbeef Stir Fry;Pepper;200g Tomatoes;2 tbsp Chilli Minced;12 Skewers, soaked in water
methods: Slice the steak into 2.5cm wide ribbons about 3mm thick, place into a large bowl.;Mix together the Kan Tong sauce, 2 tbsp oil and Tabasco, pour over the meat.;Toss through to coat.;Place the remaining 1 tbsp oil into a saute pan, add onion and cook over a medium heat until slightly softened.;Set aside to cool.;Preheat the grill to high.;Place all the salsa ingredients ( tomatoes, corn, onion, chillies, coriander, garlic, parsley ) into a food processor and blend until rich and chunky.;Check seasoning and chill until required.;Skewer the steak ribbons and onions onto the bamboo skewers, brush with a little more honey sesame sauce, then grill for 2-3 minutes each side, turning once.

ingredients: 1 tsp Brown Sugar;2 Garlic Cloves, crushed;1 pkt Burrito Seasoning Mix;1 Onion, finely sliced;Tomatoes diced;400g Schnitzel, cut into strips;1-2 tbsp Tequila Optional;375g Chunky Salsa;Limes if preferred instead of lemons;2 tsp Worcester Sauce;Juice of 2 Limes or 1 Lemon;Avocado, sliced;Flour Tortillas;Green Capsicum, sliced;Sour Cream to serve;Yellow Capsicum, sliced;Lettuce, shredded
methods: Thinly slice the schnitzel and place into a glass dish. Add the next 5 ingredients. Mix and marinate for 1-2 hours or overnight if possible. Place a little olive oil into a saute pan. Heat well. Add the marinated schnitzel. Stirfry over a high heat until just cooked. Add the seasoning mix. Stir well and remove from the heat. Meanwhile, heat the flour tortillas in the oven. Place the spicy meat onto the tortillas. Top with a selection of salad vegetables, sour cream etc. Fold over three sides. Top with a little salsa and sour cream, and serve.

ingredients: 2 tbsp Olive Oil;2 Onions, finely chopped;3 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1/2 tsp Freshly Ground Black Pepper;2 tbsp Parsley, chopped;350g Rindless, Streaky Bacon;6 Sundried Tomatoes, thinly sliced;2 Eggs, beaten;1kg Prime Beef Mince;Banrock Station Shiraz;1/2 tsp Salt
methods: Preheat the oven to 200øC.;Heat the oil in a frying pan over moderate heat and fry the onions and garlic for about 10 minutes until the onion is soft and golden.;Remove from the heat and cool. Put the onion mixture and the remaining ingredients, except the bacon into a bowl and mix well.;Line a loaf tin with the bacon and put the mince mixture evenly into the tin.;Top with bacon, cover with tinfoil and bake 1 hour or until the juices run clear when a skewer is inserted into the middle of the loaf.;Remove from the oven and serve sliced, hot or cold.

ingredients: 500g Beef Schnitzel;1/2 c Onion, thinly sliced;1/2 c Mushrooms, sliced;1/2 cup Carrots, sliced;250g Mung Bean Sprouts;1 Pkt Stir Fry Mix;2 tbsp Olive Oil;50g Cashew Nuts, chopped;1/2 c Capsicum, thinly sliced;1 pkt Asian Noodles;1 Pkt Chow Mein Mix;1 Broccoli Head
methods: Cut beef schnitzel in half. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a saute pan, add the sliced vegetables and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the Chow Mein mix and 2 tbsp of water, stir and heat. Add the bean sprouts, then place onto the beef schnitzel, roll up the schnitzel and secure with cocktail stick, return to the vegetable pan and saute for 4-5 minutes - turning often.;Cook 1/2 the noodles according to packet directions, slice the broccoli (including the stalk). Heat the remaining oil in a saute pan, add the broccoli, stir fry for 1 minute, add the stir fry mix and 1/4 cup of water. Bring to the boil. Add drained noodles, heat through. Add cashews and serve onto plates. Cut open the rolls to expose filling. Serve on the nutty noodles.

ingredients: 2 Skinless Boneless Chicken Breasts;1 tbsp Cornflour;Salt to season;1 tsp Brown Sugar;Pepper to season;Pepper to season;1 tbsp Olive Oil;Sesame Seeds;1 Bunch Spring Onions, finely chopped;1 tsp Fresh Lemon Grass, chopped;1 pkt Egg Noodles;1 tbsp Minced Chilli;2 tbsp Soy Sauce;1 Red Capsicum, deseeded and chopped;1 tsp Ginger, freshly grated;fresh produce countdown tomatoes cherry, 250g punnet;2 tbsp Vinegar
methods: Whisk the dressing ingredients together ( ginger, lemon grass, chilli, oil, soy sauce, vinegar and brown sugar ) and set aside at room temperature to allow the flavours to release and infuse. Cook the egg noodles in a large pan or boiling salted water. Drain and refresh under cold running water and drain again.;Slice the chicken into ribbons. Mix together the salt, pepper, cornflour and sesame seeds. Toss through the chicken strips. Heat 1 tablespoon Olive Oil in a large Saute pan and Saute the coated chicken strips until cooked through.;Remove the chicken strips and pour the dressing into the Saute pan. Heat to create a thin glaze. Arrange noodles onto serving plates and top with the cooked chicken. Drizzle over the warm dressing and garnish.

ingredients: 500g Beef Schnitzel, cut into thin strips;2 Garlic Cloves, crushed;1 tsp Basil, chopped and 1/2 tsp for noodles;2 Carrots, peeled and finely diced;2 tbsp Olive Oil and 2tbsp for Noodles;5 Sping Onions, sliced diagonally;2 tsp Red Curry Paste and 1/2 tsp for noodles;Sweet Chilli Stirfry Sauce;2 Celery Sticks, chopped;2 tbsp Chilli Minced;2 pkt Instant Noodles;Green Capsicum;Red Capsicum;1 C Broccoli Florets
methods: Place the olive oil into a wok or saute pan. Heat until a haze is given off. Add the beef and stirfry very quickly. Add the garlic, curry paste and basil. Stir well, then add the stirfry sauce and simmer until tender. Meanwhile, blanch the noodles in boiling water for 30 seconds and drain. Rinse under cold water and drain again (toss through a little oil to prevent sticking). In another wok or saute pan, heat the oil until very hot, add the broccoli, carrots and celery and stirfry for 1 minute. Add the remaining ingredients and stirfry until hot. Arrange noodles onto plates, top with the Thai beef and garnish with coriander and toasted cashews.

ingredients: 8 Bone-in Chicken Thighs, or 8 Thigh Fillets;2 tbsp Thai Chilli Sauce with Ginger;400g Potato Medallions;1 tsp Mexican Seasoning;1 C Coconut, plus 1 tbsp for Potatoes;Flour and Beaten Egg for coating;4 tbsp Mango Chutney, plus 1 Tbsp for Potatoes;2 Eggs;1 Capsicum, diced
methods: Mix together the chutney, 1/2 cup coconut and chilli sauce. Lift the skin on the thighs and spoon under. Stretch the skin back to seal. Dip into flour and then beaten egg. Place the remaining 1/2 cup coconut onto a tray and dip the chicken thighs to coat. Place onto a baking tray and bake at 180c for 30 minutes for bone-in, 20 minutes for boneless. Sprinkle the mexican seasoning over the potato medallions. Spread with a little chutney and coat with coconut. Bake on a tray at 180c for 10 minutes. Serve with the chicken.

ingredients: 1 tbsp Melted Butter;1 tbsp Melted Butter;1 Onion, finely chopped;1 c Mushrooms, sliced;1tsp Parsley, chopped;1 tsp Tarragon, chopped;375ml Chicken Stock;1 tbsp Tomato Paste;1 tbsp Cornflour;Salt to season;1 tbsp Flour;Pepper to season;1 Whole Chicken
methods: Pre-heat the oven to 180c.;Remove the chicken from the bag, rinse in cold water and pat dry.;Place into a roasting dish, brush with melted butter and sprinkle with flour.;Place into oven for 30 minutes per 500g or until cooked through (check no pink juices - pierce between the leg and thigh joint).;Remove from roasting dish and allow to stand for 5 minutes before carving.;Meanwhile, remove surplus oil from the juices.;Place the pan onto a hot element, add the onions and cook for 1-2 minutes.;Add the mushrooms, parsley, tarragon, stock and paste.;Mix well and heat.;Blend the cornflour and 2tbsp water together, mix well into the liquids to create a delicious mushroom jus.;Carve the chicken and serve a little jus over the top.

ingredients: 1 tsp Chopped Tarragon;1 tsp Lemon Pepper Seasoning;425g Corn Kernels, drained;2 tbsp Olive Oil;1 tbsp Flour;1 Red Onion, sliced;1kg Chicken Drumsticks;Juice and Zest of one lemon;1/2 Red Capsicum, chopped;lChicken Simmer Sauce;Rice for 4 people
methods: Place the chicken onto a tray, dust with the flour and sprinkle with the lemon pepper.;Heat the oil in a saute pan.;Add the chicken and brown over a medium-high heat, turning occasionally.;Add the onions, lemon juice and zest and the simmer sauce.;Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked (no pink juices) and the sauce rich and creamy.;Add the tarragon.;Rice: Cook enough rice for 4 people.;Place 1 tbsp olive oil into a saute pan or wok. Add the pepper, corn and rice.;Stirfry until hot. Serve onto heated plates topped with the chicken and lemon tarragon sauce.

ingredients: 500g pkt Pasta eg: Spirals;420g tin Pasta Sauce;2 Garlic cloves, crushed;Salt to taste;Garlic Bread to serve;Pepper to taste;3 tbsp Spring Onion, chopped;Juice and Zest 1 Lemon;2 tbsp Chilli, Minced;2 Avocados, peeled and chopped;12 Chicken Drumsticks or 4 Boneless Breasts
methods: Cook 4 cups of your selected pasta in plenty of salted boiling water. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Meanwhile mix 3 tbsp of pasta sauce together with 1/2 the garlic and 1/2 chilli. Spread over the chicken and BBQ for 25 minutes for the drumsticks or 12-15 minutes for the breasts, turn occasionally and baste with the sauce. Mix the remaining pasta sauce, garlic and chilli together add the avocado, onion, lemon and season to taste. Toss through the cooked pasta. Place on serving plates, add the chicken, heat the garlic bread and serve.

ingredients: 2 Cloves Garlic, crushed;2 tbsp Cream Cheese;1 tbsp Fresh Parsley, chopped;4 Panini's;Crisp Salad Leaves;Smoked Chicken Breast, sliced;1 Small Red Onion, sliced;2 C Seedless Grapes, halved;4 tbsp Natural Yoghurt;2 tbsp Roasted Cashew Nuts
methods: Heat 1 tablespoon Olive Oil in a large saute pan.;Saute the fresh chicken breasts until cooked, remove and set aside.;Place the red onion and garlic into the saute pan and saute for 1-2 minutes.;Remove the pan from the heat and mix in the cream cheese to soften.;Place the smoked and fresh chicken, onion and garlic mixture, grapes, nuts, yoghurt and parsley into a large mixing bowl.;Toss to combine and season lightly.;Toast the split Panini's, place onto serving plates and top with a selection of salad leaves.;Spoon the Chicken Veronique onto the salad leaves and garnish with grapes and mint leaves.;Chef's Tip;Fresh peaches, nectarines or plums are also delicious served with this salad.

ingredients: 1/2 c Diced Mango, 1 Tbsp for Mayo;4 Garlic Cloves, crushed;1 tbsp Sweet Chilli Sauce;1 tsp Chopped Parsley;1 tbsp Sage, chopped;2 tbsp Mayonnaise;1 Small Red Onion, chopped;Salad Leaves;1 tbsp Fresh Basil, chopped;Focaccia Bread;1kg Ground Lamb;4 Vine Ripened Tomatoes;2 Parsnips, peeled, diced and poached until tender
methods: Mix together the ground lamb, sage, basil, onion, mango and garlic.;Dice the cooked parsnip and mix into the lamb.;Form into 6 burgers and panfry, grill or BBQ for 4-5 minutes each side.;Slice and toast the focaccia and place onto serving plates.;Mix all the mayo ingredients together, spoon a little mayo onto each focaccia.;Top with a burger, scatter the salad leaves and sliced tomatoes around the burger, serve.

ingredients: Sliced Loaf, with grains;2 tsp Chilli Seasoning;Olive Oil to coat and cook;1/2 Red Onion, Sliced;Hot Chutney;300g Lamb Stir-fry;350g Cheese, grated;400g Tomatoes;1 Avocado;1 Capsicum, sliced;1 tbsp Sour Cream;Stir Fry Mix, teriyaki;Toothpicks
methods: Roll out 12 slices of bread to make thinner, leave to one side. Slice the lamb into strips. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saute pan, add the lamb. Cook for 1 minute. Add the Maggi mix, stir to coat. Add sufficient juice from tomatoes to provide a thick sauce. Stir and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the onion and capsicum. Place spoonful of mix onto the bread, roll up to make fajitas, secure with a toothpick. Place all 12 onto a baking dish. Brush with oil. Bake at 180c for 6-8 minutes until the bread crisps slightly. Meanwhile, place the avocado flesh, drained tomatoes, chilli and sour cream in a bowl, mix and mash to combine. Place 3 fajitas onto a serving plate, remove toothpicks, top with the salsa, add a little grated cheese and serve with a crisp green salad.

ingredients: 4 Steaks, eg: Rump;2 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped;1 Onion, sliced into rings;1 tsp each, paprika, garlic powder, coriander, cumin, garam masala;;;;;Pepper to Taste;1 tbsp Olive Oil, plus extra to cook;2 tbsp Plain Flour;4 Large Potatoes, cut into wedges;2 Hamburger Buns, split in half;4 tbsp Mayonnaise;2 Vine Ripened Tomatoes, sliced;4 Pineapple rings, grilled;1 tbsp Soy Sauce;1 tsp Chilli Paste;125mls Soda Water;Lettuce for serving
methods: Place wedges into roasting tray, sprinkle over the spices and drizzle with 2 tbsp soya oil. Place the wedges into a preheated 200c oven and roast 40 minutes until crisp and golden. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a saute pan and add your selected steaks. Cook 3-4 minutes each side for medium. Remove and set aside. Add garlic and soy sauce to pan juices and heat to combine. Place the flour and soda water into a bowl and whisk to make a thin batter. Heat 300mls of soya oil in a saucepan. Dip the onion rings into the batter, and fry a few at a time until crisp and golden. Drain on kitchen paper.;To Build;Toast burger buns and mix mayonnaise and red chilli together. Place burger buns onto serving plates. Top with the lettuce, tomatoes, a slice of grilled pineapple and steak. Pile high with onion rings then drizzle the chilli mayo onto and around the steak stacks. Serve the spiced wedges.

ingredients: 100g Butter, cubed;Salt;300g Chicken, skinned and diced;Black Pepper;1 tbsp Olive Oil;6 c Self Raising Flour;2 cMilk;2 tbsp Pizza Toppings;2 Garlic Cloves, crushed;2 tbsp Margarine;4 Slices Bacon, diced;2 Eggs, one for waffles;1 c Cheese, grated;2 tsp Lemon Juice;4 tbsp Pineapple, drained
methods: Roll out the pizza dough ( see below ) to approx. 2 x 30cm. Place on a lightly oiled oven tray or terracotta tile. Heat the oil in a saute pan, add the chicken and bacon, saute until just cooked. Mix together the pizza topping, margarine and garlic and spread over the pizza bases. Top with the chicken and bacon, add the pineapple and cheese. Bake at 220c for 20 minutes until crisp and bubbling.;For the dough: In a food processor, blend the flour, butter, salt and pepper until it resembles breadcrumbs. Add the milk and lemon juice, mix until it forms a dough ball. Place onto a floured board, knead lightly, then roll out to desired pizza shape.

ingredients: 500g Torroncini Pasta;Parsley, Lemon and Focaccia to serve;1 Tbsp Olive Oil;Foccacia Bread herb & garlic;1 Small Red Onion, sliced;1 Green Capsicum, sliced;100g Cooked Prawns, optional;500g Fresh Tarakihi, or other firm fleshed fish;575g Chunky Pasta Sauce, your favourite
methods: Cook the torroncini in plenty of boiling water for 15 minutes, drain.;Mix in the pasta sauce and heat through.;Heat the olive oil in a saute pan, saute the fish fillets 2-3 minutes each side, saute the capsicum and prawns alongside.;Place a stack of coated pasta onto serving plates, top with the fish. Spoon the prawns, capsicum and pan juices around the side.;Garnish with chopped parsley, lemon wedges and serve with fresh focaccia.;Chef's tip: Fresh steamed asparagus partners this pasta dish impeccably!

ingredients: Chicken Breasts, boneless and butterflied;2 Cloves Garlic, crushed;250g Sour Cream;Cherry Tomatoes, halved to serve;500g Potatoes, halved;1 Piece Fresh Lemongrass, chopped;2 tbsp Fresh Coriander, chopped;3 tsp Spring Onion, chopped;Juice and Zest of 1 Lemon or Lime;Lindemans Chardonnay, bin 65;1 tsp Fresh Ginger, finely chopped;Shredded lettuce to serve
methods: Cook the potatoes in boiling water for 10-15 minutes until tender.;Mix together the juice, zest, garlic, lemongrass, and coriander.;Spoon a little over each chicken breast.;Barbecue the chicken breasts until cooked through.;Mix together the remaining lemon and coriander mixture with the spring onion and sour cream.;Allow the potatoes to cool slightly and toss together with the sour cream dressing.;To Serve:;Arrange Romaine onto salad plates and top with the warm chicken. Serve the lemongrass potato salad alongside and garnish with cherry tomatoes and crusty bread.

ingredients: 2 tsp Olive Oil;700g of pork loin;2 pkts 2 Minute Noodles;2 Garlic Cloves, crushed;1 Bunch Spring Onions, 7.5cm lengths;1 Apple, Peeled and Sliced;100g Button Mushrooms, sliced;1C Silverbeet;2 tbsp Soy Sauce;4 tbsp Juice from Canned Fruit ( use the fruit for dessert );Salt & Pepper
methods: Heat the oil in a saute pan, add the pork. Seal both sides of the meat, cook for 4-5 minutes each side.;Meanwhile, cook the 2-minute noodles as per the packet directions.;Remove the pork slices, cut into strips.;Add the sliced apple, garlic, and mushrooms to pan. Cook for 2 minutes, or until slightly soft. Add spring onions and shredded greens. Heat to wilt.;Add the soy sauce and fruit juice, season and toss to coat.;Place the noodles onto serving plates, add the cooked greens, top with the pork and pour over the pan juices.;Add black pepper and serve.

ingredients: 4 Boneless Chicken Breasts, sliced;200g Shoulder Bacon, diced;1 Small Onion, chopped;Cajun Seasoning to dust;Stirfry Vegetables to serve;1 tbsp Olive Oil;2 tbsp Sweet Chilli and Garlic Sauce plus 2 Tbsp Extra;1 Egg, beaten;1/2 c Cheese, grated;1 pkt Filo Pastry;1 Small Red Capsicum, chopped
methods: Heat oil in saute pan, lightly brown chicken and bacon, add the onion and pepper. Cook 2-3 minutes. Remove the ingredients with a slotted spoon, mix with the chilli sauce and mustard. Reserve the pan juices. Lay 3 sheets of filo on top of each other, making a star shape. Spoon the fiery chicken onto the pastry. Brush edges with beaten egg. Bring up the edges and twist to encase the filling.;Repeat to make four crackers.;Place onto baking tray, brush with beaten egg and lightly dust with Cajun seasoning. Bake at 200c for 10-15 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the reserved juices together with the extra chilli sauce. Stirfry the vegetables and serve.

ingredients: 500g Tenderbeef Topside;1 pkt Asian Home Gourmet Rogan Josh Spice Paste;410g Coconut Cream;1 Onion, sliced;500g Basmati Rice;Can Cut Corn, drained;2 tbsp Butter;425g Chinese Vegetable Mix;Asia at Home Biryani Rice Spice Paste;2 tbsp Olive Oil;2 Kumara, skin on washed and diced;100g Nuts and Raisins
methods: Heat oil in a saute pan. Dice the topside into bite-size pieces, dust in flour. Brown in hot oil, add the onion, kumara and spice paste, coat well. Add the coconut cream, stir and cover. Simmer for 25-30 minutes. Remove lid, season and stir. Simmer for 10 minutes until tender.;For the rice: Cook 2 cups of rice in cups of boiling water for 10 minutes, drain. Meanwhile, heat the butter in a saute pan, add the vegetables and spice paste. Stir to coat. Add the cooked rice to colour and flavour. Serve sprinkled with nuts and raisins and a little fresh coriander.

ingredients: 1 Onion, chopped;2 Garlic Cloves, crushed;2 Tomatoes, diced;250g Sour Cream;1 tbsp Olive Oil;1 c Mozarella Cheese, grated;600g Ground Beef;1 tsp Chill Seasoning;1 Avocado, diced;Old El Paso Mexican Burrito Kit;1 Lettuce;4 Zucchini
methods: Place the oil in a saute pan, add the ground Tenderbeef and cook until brown. Add onion and garlic. Dice 2 zucchini chunky, add to the beef together with half the enchilada sauce. Mix well, simmer for 3-4 minutes. Remove the freshness pouch from the enchilada packet and microwave the enchiladas in the packet on high for 1 minute. Dice the remaining zucchini with the tomatoes and avocado. Add 1 tbsp sour cream and the chilli seasoning. Shred half the lettuce. Spoon 2 tbsp beef mix into each enchilada. Roll up and place onto oven tray seam side down. Spread over the remaining sauce and the cheese and bake at 180c for 10 minutes. Serve alongside the lettuce, topped with the tomato and zucchini salsa.

ingredients: 4 Boneless Chicken Breasts or legs;1 tsp Chinese Five Spices;2 tbsp Butter;500g Pasta eg: Fettuccine;2 tbsp Maple Syrup;1 tsp Chilli Seasoning;2 tbsp Soy Sauce;6 Plums
methods: Mix together the maple syrup, soy sauce and spice.;Marinate the chicken for 30 minutes.;Then bbq or pan-fry, allow 10-15 minutes for the breasts or 20-25 minutes for the legs.;For the Plums:;Halve and de-stone the plums, heat the butter in a saute pan. Add the plums, cut side down, and allow to cook for 2-3 minutes. Turn and sprinkle with chilli. Cook for a further 3 minutes.;For the Pasta:;Cook 2/3 of the pasta in plenty of salted boiling water, until tender to the bite. Drain and toss through the butter, season and stack onto serving plates. Add the chicken and plums. Pour any plum juices over the pasta.

ingredients: 2 tbsp Olive Oil;2 tbsp Pickle;425g Baked Beans;1/2 Red Onion, chopped;1 tsp Mustard;1/2 c Cheese, grated;1 Celery Stick, chopped;1 Whole Chicken cut into 4 Large Portions;2 tbsp Chutney Sauce plus 1 tbsp for beans;4 Slices Ham
methods: Heat oil in an ovenproof saute pan. Add the chicken, brown well, turning often. Mix the sauce and pickle together, spread over the chicken. Place into a 180c oven for 15 minutes. Add a slice of ham to each chicken piece, top with the cheese. Cook for a further 5 minutes approx. until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken, keep warm. Place the pan onto heat, add the celery and onions, cook for 2 minutes until softened. Add the remaining ingredients. Heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Serve the chicken on warm plates with a big chunk of ciabatta bread.

ingredients: 1/2 tsp Chilli Seasoning;2 tbsp Brown Sugar;1 tbsp Chopped Parsley;1 tbsp Sweet Thai Sauce;8 Pieces Corn on the Cob;1 Small Red Onion;4 Slices Bacon, rind removed;4 tbsp Tomato Chutney;2 tbsp Worcester Sauce;8-10 Chicken Portions;1 tbsp Minced Chilli;410g Can Peach Slices
methods: For the chicken:;Pour the juice from the peaches into a saucepan, add the remaining glaze ingredients and bring to the boil, simmer until rich and syrupy.;Place chicken onto a baking tray lined with cooking paper.;Brush over the glaze, bake at 180c for 20 minutes (thighs, drums) or 30 minutes (legs), brushing over plenty of glaze during cooking.;For the salsa: Cook the bacon alongside the chicken until golden, then chop.;Chop the peaches, mix with bacon and remaining salsa ingredients ( chilli, parsley, chilli sauce, red onion );Cook the corn as per packet directions, butter and season.;Serve with the chicken and salsa with warm bread rolls.

ingredients: 2 Onions;4 tsp Curry Powder;250mls Creme Fraiche;1/2 Melon or Mango, diced;1 c Chopped Parsley;50g Butter;100mls Mayonnaise;2 X 225g Rice Risotto;1 Bay leaf;1 kg Chicken Portions;Juice and Zest 1 Lemon;3 tbsp Mango Chutney
methods: Place chicken, bay leaf and 1 onion quartered into a large saucepan. Cover with water and simmer for 40-50 minutes until tender. Allow to cool in the stock. Then refrigerate.;Finely chop 1 onion, mix with the curry powder, mango chutney, lemon, mayonnaise and creme fraiche.
