In a small jug, whisk gelatine briskly into boiling water, until dissolved. Cool slightly. Blend into cream mixture.;4. Divide mixture evenly between prepared moulds. Chill, covered, for 3 hours or overnight, until set. Serve with chocolate hearts.;Tip: to make chocolate hearts melt chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water, transfer to a piping bag and pipe heart shapes onto baking paper. Place in the fridge to cool for 10 minutes.

ingredients: 200 g dark eating chocolate, chopped;2 Tbsp thickened cream;2 tsp finely grated orange zest;1/4 cup finely chopped raisins;2 Tbsp cocoa powder, to dust;24 small coffee beans
methods: 1. Combine 160g of the chocolate and the cream in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring until chocolate is just melted. Transfer to a medium heatproof bowl. Stir in zest and raisins. Chill in the fridge for 4-6 hours or until firm. Roll 1 1/2 teaspoons of the chocolate mixture into balls. Place on a large plate. Chill until firm. Dust tops with cocoa powder.;2. Microwave remaining chocolate on High for 20-30 seconds or until melted. Spread the rounded side of the coffee beans with a little chocolate; press onto balls. Chill in the fridge until firm.

ingredients: Butter, for greasing;3 cups rice bubbles;200g packet Tim Tams, chopped, plus extra to serve;200g milk chocolate, melted;1/4 cup desiccated coconut;2 tsp powdered gelatine;1/4 cup boiling water;500g cream cheese, softened, chopped;1/2 cup caster sugar;1 tsp vanilla essence;1 cup thickened cream;100g dark chocolate, melted, cooled;Whipped cream, to serve
methods: 1. Lightly grease and line a 20cm springform cake tin with baking paper.;2. In a large bowl, combine rice bubbles, Tim Tams, chocolate and coconut, stirring well. Press into base and side of pan. Chill for 30 minutes until set.;3. In a heat-proof jug, vigorously whisk gelatine into water with a fork until dissolved. Set aside to cool.;4. Using a food processor, combine cream cheese, caster sugar and vanilla. Pulse until smooth. Add cream and gelatine mixture. Process until well combined. Pour in melted chocolate, pulsing until smooth.;5. Pour mixture into cake tin. Chill for 6 hours or until set. Serve topped with whipped cream and extra chopped Tim Tams.;Tip:;This dish is best prepared the day before to ensure it is firm. Do not freeze.;PER SERVE;• Energy 2455Kj • Protein 6g • Total Fat 41g • Saturated Fat 26g • Carbohydrates 48g • Sugars 38g • Sodium 352mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.;How to Make Chocolate Nests

ingredients: 2 cups icing sugar;4 cups desiccated coconut, plus 1/2 cup extra;395g can sweetened condensed milk;3 drops pink food colouring
methods: 1. Sift icing sugar into a large bowl. Add coconut and condensed milk, stir until well combined. Transfer half the mixture to a separate bowl. Add the food colouring to one portion and mix until well combined.;2. Roll teaspoons of each mixture, separately, into balls. Place on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Roll each ball into the extra coconut. Chill for 1 hour in the fridge or until firm.;Tip: You can make snowballs up to 1 week ahead. Cover, then refrigerate until required.

ingredients: 450g store-bought dark chocolate mud cake with icing, broken into chunks;1/3 cup sultanas;1 tsp ground cinnamon;200g dark chocolate melts;50g white chocolate melts
methods: 1. In a food processor, combine cake, sultanas and cinnamon. Process until combined and mixture forms a soft ball.;2. Roll tablespoons of mixture into balls. Flatten the base to form a bun shape. Freeze for 20 minutes.;3. Meanwhile put dark chocolate melts in a microwave safe dish and microwave on high in 30 second bursts, stirring in between, until melted. Repeat with the white chocolate, in a separate dish.;4. Line a tray with baking paper. Insert the tip of a fork into the base of a chilled ball. Dip into dark chocolate to coat, allowing excess to drizzle back into the bowl.;5. Using another fork, carefully push the ball from the fork onto prepared tray. Repeat with remaining balls and chocolate. Chill.;6. Pour white chocolate into a small resealable bag. Push chocolate into one corner and snip off tip of bag. Carefully draw crosses over each ball.;7. Allow to set before placing in a gift bag or box.;PER SERVE;• Energy 961Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 11g • Saturated Fat 6g • Carbohydrates 30g • Sugars 24g • Sodium 59mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: 1 bakery sponge cake, cut into 3cm cubes;6 cups fresh berries;1 litre store bought custard;250ml cream;2 cups fresh berries for garnish;Icing sugar for dusting
methods: 1. Measure out 1/2 cup sherry. In the base of a 2 litre glass bowl place a layer of sponge cubes. Sprinkle with a little sherry. Top with 2 cups of fresh berries followed by a layer of custard. Repeat the process finishing with berries.;2. Whip the cream until it forms soft peaks. Spread over the trifle and top with the extra berries for garnish. Dust with icing sugar just before serving.;Tip: Trifle always tastes best the day after it is made. The flavours will have had time to infuse and develop.

ingredients: 4 sheets filo pastry;50g butter, melted;1 Tbsp caster sugar plus 1/3 cup for the filling;250g cream cheese, softened;1/2 cup sour cream;1 tsp vanilla essence;1 lemon, zest finely grated, plus 1/4 cup juice;1 tsp gelatine;125g strawberries, thinly sliced;2 passionfruit, pulp only
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced. Lightly grease a 24-hole mini muffin pan.;2. Layer filo sheets, brushing each sheet with butter and sprinkling with a little sugar (1 tablespoon to be used across all 3 layers). Brush top layer with butter. Cut filo stack into 24 equal squares. Line muffin holes with pastry, buttered side down.;3. Bake for 6-8 minutes until lightly golden and crisp. Cool in the tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.;4. In a small bowl, using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese, sour cream, remaining sugar and vanilla essence until smooth. Beat in lemon zest and juice.;5. Place 1 Tbsp boiled water into a small jug. Sprinkle gelatine over and whisk vigorously with a fork to dissolve. Whisk into cream cheese mixture.;6. Divide mixture between each case to fill, then chill for 1-2 hours until set. Top with strawberries and passionfruit to serve.;PER SERVE;• Energy 337Kj • Protein 1g • Total Fat 7g • Saturated Fat 4g • Carbohydrates 6g • Sugars 2g • Sodium 98mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 200g Free From Gluten Gingernut Biscuits;85g butter, melted;400g cream cheese;60g caster sugar;2 Tbsp lemon juice, plus zest of 1/2 a lemon;200ml cream
methods: 1. Line the base of a 20cm spring form tin with baking paper.;2. Place the biscuits into food processor and blitz until they resemble fine bread crumbs or place them into a plastic bag and bash with a rolling pin. Add the melted butter, mix well and place in the tin. Spread evenly pressing down with the back of a spoon. Place into the fridge for 10 minutes while you make the filling.;3.Place the cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice and zest into a bowl and beat until smooth and well blended.;4. Add the cream and continue to beat until the mixture is thick and smooth. Pour over the base, smooth the top and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

ingredients: 380 g caramel condensed milk;1 cup brown sugar;125 g butter, chopped;1/2 tsp sea salt
methods: 1. Lightly grease and line a 15cm square cake pan with baking paper. In a medium saucepan, combine caramel condensed milk, brown sugar and butter, then stir well.;2. Boil for 8-10 minutes until golden and thick. Pour into pan and allow to cool completely.;3. Cut into bite-sized pieces and sprinkle with sea salt to serve.;PER SERVE;• Energy 708Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 8g • Saturated Fat 5g • Carbohydrates 23g • Sugars 23g • Sodium 125mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: 3 eggs;100g caster sugar;300ml cream, whipped;200g white chocolate bits;500g fresh cherries nz, per kg loose
methods: 1. Line a 1.5L loaf pan with plastic wrap, leaving enough at the sides to overlap and cover the top of the semi-freddo.;2. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and caster sugar until thick and pale. Fold in the whipped cream and chocolate. Fold in the cherries until just combined – be careful not to overmix.;3. Pour into the prepared pan and fold over the plastic wrap. Freeze for several hours, or overnight.;4. Turn the semi-freddo out onto a platter. Leave for a few minutes to partly melt. Decorate with extra cherries.;Per Serve;• Energy 1558kj • Protein 6g • Total Fat 24g • Saturated Fat 14g • Carbohydrates 33g • Sugars 33g • Sodium 66mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 1 cup flour;1 tsp baking powder;1 egg;1 ripe banana, mashed;1/2 cup milk (you may not use all of it);Zest and flesh of 1 mandarin;1 kiwifruit, finely diced;1 tsp butter
methods: 1. In a large bowl sift in the flour and baking powder. Add the egg, and banana. Add the milk and stir slowly until you get a pourable consistency, you may not need to use all of the milk. Whisk all the ingredients together until combined.;2. Dice the mandarin flesh and fold through the mixture along with the mandarin zest and kiwifruit.;3. In a large frying pan, melt the butter. Add tablespoonfuls of mixture into the pan. Cook until the pikelet starts to bubble then flip over and cook for a further 2 minutes. Repeat with remaining mixture.;4. Remove from the pan, cool slightly and serve warm.;PER SERVE;• Energy 720Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 9g • Saturated Fat 5g • Carbohydrates 21g • Sugars 15g • Sodium 87mg

ingredients: 1/4 cup brown sugar;1/4 cup caster sugar;3/4 cup plain flour;1 tsp ground cinnamon;100g butter, coarsely chopped;3/4 cup rolled oats;1/2 cup macadamias, roasted, coarsely chopped;500g frozen blueberries;1 Tbsp lemon juice;Vanilla ice-cream, to serve (optional)
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan-forced).;2. Sift sugars, flour and cinnamon into medium bowl. Rub in butter. Stir in oats and nuts.;3. Combine blueberries with juice and extra sugar in medium bowl.;4. Divide blueberry mixture among four small ovenproof dishes. Sprinkle with crumble topping. Bake about 40 minutes. Serve ice-cream.

ingredients: 115g dairy free spread, plus extra for greasing;1 cup rice or almond milk, plus a drizzle for the icing;3/4 cup sugar;2 Tbsp golden syrup;4 Tbsp dark cocoa;1 1/2 cups gluten free flour;1 tsp baking soda;Dark chocolate (65% cocoa), grated, to decorate;2 cups icing sugar;3 Tbsp cocoa powder;1/4 cup dairy free spread
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced). Line 12 muffin tray holes with paper cases.;2. Gently melt the dairy free spread, 1/2 cup milk alternative, sugar and golden syrup in a saucepan. Cool slightly, then sift in the cocoa and flour, mixing to combine.;3. Dissolve the baking soda in the remaining milk and stir into the batter, mixing well. It should be a thick, pourable batter.;4. Pour into the paper cases and bake for 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the tin.;5. Meanwhile, to make the icing, combine the ingredients in a mediumsized bowl. Mix well to form a smooth, thick paste. Pour into a piping bag or snaplock bag with the corner cut off.;6. When the cupcakes are completely cooled, pipe icing onto cupcakes and decorate with grated dark chocolate.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1499Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 12g • Saturated Fat 3g • Carbohydrates 60g • Sugars 44g • Sodium 182mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: ½ Strawberry cheesecake;1 cup ice;1 ½ cups milk;1 Tbsp chopped mint, plus extra leaves to garnish
methods: 1. Into a blender place the cheesecake, ice, milk and mint. Blitz until smooth.;2. Serve garnished with mint.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1963Kj • Protein 11g • Total Fat 26g • Saturated Fat 15g • Carbohydrates 48g • Sugars 35g • Sodium 229mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 3 cups plain flour;3 tsp baking powder;180g butter, softened plus 20g for base plus 50g for sauce;1 cup sugar;3 eggs;1 tsp vanilla extract;3/4 cup buttermilk;6 pears peeled, cored and quartered;1 tsp cinnamon;1 Tbsp caster sugar;1 cup brown sugar;1/2 cup cream
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan-forced). Line a 25cm spring-form tin with baking paper.;2. In a medium bowl, sift the flour and baking powder together.;3. In a separate medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar together using a beater until pale and creamy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until the batter is well mixed. Add the vanilla.;4. Stir in half of the flour mixture, followed by the buttermilk, then the remaining flour. Stir to combine.;5. To make the base; in a medium bowl combine the butter, cinnamon and sugar. Spread into the base of the prepared tin. Cover with the;pears, cut side up in a circular pattern.;6. Scrape batter into the prepared tin and smooth the top with the back of a wet spoon.;7. Bake for 40 minutes, or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly.;8. Meanwhile, to make the butterscotch sauce; in a saucepan, over a high, heat combine ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cook until it;thickens slightly. Remove from the heat, and cool slightly.;9. To serve; turn cake upside down so the pears are on the top and drizzle with the butterscotch sauce drizzled over top.;PER SERVE;• Energy 2536Kj • Protein 8g • Total Fat 26g • Saturated Fat 16g • Carbohydrates 83g • Sugars 55g • Sodium 291mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 1 1/3 cups plain flour, plus extra for kneading;150g butter, chilled, diced;2/3 cup icing sugar, plus extra to dust;2 tsp baking powder;3 egg yolks;300ml thickened cream, whipped;3x250g punnets strawberries, hulled
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced). Grease a 22cm springform pan. Line a baking tray with baking paper.;2. Sift flour and a pinch of salt into a large bowl and stir in butter. Using your fingertips, rub butter into flour until mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Sift in icing sugar and baking powder.;3. Using a large spoon, mix in yolks until dough just comes together. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Lightly pull dough together to form a ball. Place on prepared tray and press down to form a 1cm-thick, 22cm-diameter circle. Chill for 20 minutes.;4. Place springform ring around pastry to help keep its shape. Prick pastry with a fork and bake for 25 minutes, until golden and risen. Set aside to cool fully on tray.;5. To serve, spread whipped cream over pastry. Top with strawberries and dust with extra icing sugar.;PER SERVE;• Energy 2597Kj • Protein 6g • Total Fat 44g • Saturated Fat 26g • Carbohydrates 50g • Sugars 28g • Sodium 453mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 1 cup water;1 cup caster sugar;1 tsp vanilla extract;700g apricots, quartered, stones removed,;250g mascarpone;2 Tbsp icing sugar;Brioche or fruit bread, sliced and toasted
methods: 1. Combine water, sugar and vanilla extract in a medium-sized saucepan. Stir on a low heat until sugar dissolves.;2. Increase heat to medium and simmer for 15 minutes.;3. Add apricots, reduce heat to low and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until apricots are soft and compote thickens. Set aside to cool.;4. In a small bowl, mix together mascarpone and icing sugar until smooth.;5. To serve, spread mascarpone mixture onto toasted brioche and top with apricot compote;Tip;Keep leftover compote in a jar in the fridge – it’s great on toast or ice cream.;Per Serve;• Energy 611kj • Protein 1.5g • Total Fat 3.5g • Saturated Fat 1.5g • Carbohydrates 26g • Sugars 21g • Sodium 48mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 1 telegraph cucumber;1 red capsicum, finely sliced;1 avocado, finely sliced;1/2 cup cooked sushi rice;Soy sauce, to serve (optional)
methods: 1. Cut cucumber into four pieces. Using an apple corer, hollow out the centres to remove the seeds.;2. Add a few slices of capsicum and avocado into the cavity to fill half of it.;3. Add the rice into the other side of the cavity and press to compact it until completely filled.;4. Cut into 2cm sushi slices. Serve with soy sauce, if desired.;Fresh Tip: You can also use any fresh veges you like for the filling.;PER SERVE;• Energy 193Kj • Protein 1g • Total Fat 3g • Saturated Fat 0g • Carbohydrates 3g • Sugars 2g • Sodium 16mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: 125g butter, chopped, at room temperature;1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar;1/2 cup honey;1 egg yolk;1 1/2 cups plain flour;1/2 tsp baking soda;1 Tbsp ground ginger;1 tsp ground cinnamon;1/4 tsp ground cloves;1 1/2 cups icing sugar;1/3 cup coloured sprinkles
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan forced). Line 2 baking trays with baking paper.;2. Using an electric mixer, beat butter, sugar and honey in a bowl. Add egg yolk and beat to combine. Add flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon and cloves. Stir to combine. Turn out onto a floured surface and gently knead until smooth.;3. Using a rolling pin, roll dough on a lightly floured bench until 5mm thick. Using a 7cm pastry cutter, cut 20 discs from dough. Using a 2cm round cutter, cut a disc from the centre of each biscuit. Place on prepared trays, leaving room for spreading. Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden and leave to cool on the trays.;4. Combine icing sugar and enough water to form a firm spreadable icing. Spread icing over biscuits. Add sprinkles. Serve when set.;PER SERVE;• Energy 912Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 6g • Saturated Fat 3g • Carbohydrates 39g • Sugars 28g • Sodium 69mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 1 punnet of blueberries;1 punnet of strawberries, chopped;1 kiwifruit, peeled and chopped;2 cups coconut water
methods: 1. Divide fruit evenly between ice-block moulds.;2. Fill with coconut water. Insert sticks and freeze overnight until firm.;Tip: you can really use any fruits that are in season!

ingredients: 10 feijoas, peeled and quartered;2 granny smith apples, peeled, cored and cut into chunks;1/2 juice of a lemon;3/4 cup water;3/4 cup sugar;2 eggs;1/2 cup flour;1 tsp baking powder;1/4 cup milk;icing sugar, for dusting
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced). Put fruits, lemon juice, water and 1/4 cup sugar in a pot. Cover and simmer until soft, about 10 minutes.;2. Beat eggs with remaining sugar until thick and pale. Sift in flour and baking powder and fold in with the milk.;3. Pour hot fruit into 6 tea cups or ramekins or one large dish, top with sponge mixture and bake at 180°C (160°C fan-forced) for about 30 minutes, until golden and springy to touch. Sprinkle with icing sugar and serve warm.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1011Kj • Protein 4g • Total Fat 2g • Saturated Fat 1g • Carbohydrates 49g • Sugars 41g • Sodium 99mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: 1 Strawberry cheesecake;1 Tbsp lemon zest;½ cup white chocolate, roughly chopped;½ cup almonds, finely chopped;½ cup pistachios, finely chopped;½ cup cocoa powder
methods: 1. In a large bowl, mash the cheesecake, lemon zest and white chocolate together using a fork.;2. Roll into walnuts size balls (if mix is too soft, put in the freezer for 10-15 minutes before rolling). Freeze rolled balls for 2 hours.;3. Roll a third of the balls in the almonds, a third in the pistachios and a third into the cocoa. Refreeze until ready to serve.;PER SERVE (2 per serve);• Energy 1403Kj • Protein 7g • Total Fat 23g • Saturated Fat 9g • Carbohydrates 25g • Sugars 17g • Sodium 85mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 250g butter, softened;3/4 cup white sugar;3/4 cup brown sugar;2 1/2 cups plain flour, sifted;1/4 cup mandarin juice, plus 1 Tbsp zest;1 tsp baking soda;1 egg;1 1/2 cups milk chocolate chips
methods: 1 Preheat the oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced).;2. In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light. Add the flour, mandarin zest, juice, baking soda and egg. Mix until combined.;3. Fold in the chocolate chips then roll or scoop the mixture into balls. Place on greased baking trays, allowing room for spreading.;4. Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden, then cool slightly on the trays before transferring to cooling racks to cool completely. The cookies are fragile when warm but will firm up when cooled.;PER SERVE;• Energy 720Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 9g • Saturated Fat 5g • Carbohydrates 21g • Sugars 15g • Sodium 87mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation.

ingredients: 3/4 cup wholemeal plain flour;1 Tbsp cacao powder;1 tsp baking powder;1/2 tsp bicarbonate of soda;1 egg, lightly beaten;1 ripe banana, mashed;1 cup buttermilk;Olive oil spray;4 cups sliced banana, halved strawberries and blueberries;Honey or pure maple syrup;1 cup low-fat Greek-style yoghurt, to serve
methods: 1. Blend flour, cacao, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda, egg, banana and buttermilk in a blender or with a stick blender until smooth. Set aside to rest for 10 minutes, then transfer pancake batter to a squeezable bottle (this makes shaping easier).;2. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spray with oil.;3. Working quickly, squeeze one large circle of batter into pan, then squeeze two small circles for ears so they are touching the large circle and cook for 1-2 minutes or until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip over and cook for a further 1 minute. Transfer to plates and repeat with remaining batter.;4. Drizzle pancakes with honey or maple syrup, top with fresh fruit, and serve with yoghurt.;Nutritional Info;Per serve: 8g protein, 7g fat (2g sat fat), 32g carb, 17g sugars, 5g dietary fibre, 290mg sodium, 1000kJ (240 cals)

ingredients: 8 Countdown Chicken Tenders;1 courgette, sliced into rounds;1 red capsicum, cut into cubes;1 red onion, cut into chunks;12 bamboo skewers;½ cup chipotle sauce;1 bag salad, to serve
methods: 1. Preheat an oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced).;2. Cut 8 chicken tenders into 4 pieces each.;3. Thread a piece of chicken, courgette, capsicum and red onion onto the skewers, repeating the process finishing with chicken.;4. Repeat for the remaining skewers.;5. Place onto a baking tray, spray with a little oil and bake for 15 minutes until cooked and lightly browned.;6. Serve hot with salad & chipotle sauce.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1008Kj • Protein 18g • Total Fat 8g • Saturated Fat 1g • Carbohydrates 23g • Sugars 10g • Sodium 486mg

ingredients: 1 dried apricot;3 dates, pitted, halved;2 cups untoasted muesli;250g strawberries, hulled, sliced;60g blueberries;500g plain yoghurt with no added sugar;12 currants
methods: 1. Cut 6 small wedge shapes from apricot for noses. Cut fork shapes from date to resemble twig arms.;2. Divide muesli among 6 tumblers and top with berries. Fit a piping bag with a fluted nozzle and fill with yoghurt.;3. Pipe yoghurt into tumblers, then arrange currants for eyes on top, with apricot noses and date arms to serve.;Nutritional Information;Per cup: 9g protein, 4g fat (1g sat fat), 36g carb, 16g sugars, 6g dietary fibre, 105mg sodium, 980kJ (235 cals)

ingredients: 250g lamb mince;2 spring onions, finely sliced;1 egg, whisked;1 Tbsp barbeque sauce;Salt and pepper, to taste;Spray oil;4 pita pockets;1 punnet cherry tomatoes, halved;2 celery stalks, cut into sticks;1 capsicum, cut into sticks
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced).;2. In a medium bowl, combine lamb mince, spring onion, egg and barbeque sauce. Season to taste.;3. Form mixture into walnut-sized balls. Arrange on a lined baking tray and spray with oil.;4. Bake for 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked through. Allow to cool.;5. Divide meat balls, pita pockets and vegetables evenly to make 4 lunches. If not using right away, store meatballs chilled in an airtight container until required.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1219Kj • Protein 21g • Total Fat 10g • Saturated Fat 3g • Carbohydrates 28g • Sugars 6g • Sodium 766mg;Dietary and Nutritional information supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: 2 sheets frozen shortcrust pastry, thawed;2 eggs;1/4 cup cream;2 Tbsp milk;Salt, to taste;Pepper, to taste;1/4 cup grated tasty cheese;12 cherry tomatoes, halved;8 whole parsley leaves
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan-forced). Lightly grease 8 x 8cm fluted, loose-bottom flan pans.;2. Cut 8 x 10cm rounds from the pastry and press into pans. Prick the base with a fork then chill for 10 minutes. Bake for 5-6 minutes, until lightly golden.;3. In a small jug, whisk eggs, cream and milk together with a fork. Season to taste. Pour evenly into the tart cases and sprinkle with the cheese.;4. Gently press 3 tomato halves and 1 parsley leaf into the egg mixture. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until set.;PER SERVE;• Energy 1436Kj • Protein 7g • Total Fat 21g • Saturated Fat 13g • Carbohydrates 31g • Sugars 2g • Sodium 477mg;Dietary and nutritional info supplied by NZ Nutrition Foundation

ingredients: ½ cup self-rising flour;1 Smiling Tums Sweet Potato, Carrot & Parsnip pouch;2 eggs;½ cup grated cheese, plus 2 Tbsp extra;½ cup frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced). Grease a 12-hole mini muffin tin.;2. In a large bowl, place the flour. In another bowl whisk together the Smiling Tums pouch, eggs, cheese and vegetables. Pour into the flour and combine well.;3. Spoon the mixture into the muffin tins and sprinkle with the extra cheese. Bake for 20 minutes until golden and set.;4. Remove from the oven and sit for 10 minutes before removing from the tin.;Tip: To make this gluten free, use gluten free self-raising flour.;PER SERVE;Energy 283Kj • Protein 4g • Total Fat 3g • Saturated Fat 2g • Carbohydrates 5g • Sugars 1g • Sodium 100mg

ingredients: 1 cup self-raising flour;1 Smiling Tums Apples, Pear & Cinnamon pouch;1 egg;½ apple, grated;20g butter, melted;2 Tbsp milk;1 tsp cinnamon
methods: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan-forced). Lightly grease a 12-hole mini muffin tin.;2. Place the flour into a medium sized bowl. In another bowl combine the Smiling Tums pouch, egg, apple, butter and milk. Pour into the flour and mix to combine – be careful not to over-mix.;3. Spoon the mixture into the greased muffin tin. Sprinkle with cinnamon and bake for 12 minutes.;4. Remove from the oven and cool before removing from the tin.;PER SERVE;Energy 269Kj • Protein 2g • Total Fat 2g • Saturated Fat 1g • Carbohydrates 9g • Sugars 2g • Sodium 87mg

ingredients: Fresh pineapple;4 oranges, peeled, sliced, halved;230g blueberries;250g strawberries;2 Tbsp plain yoghurt
methods: 1. Cut 2 pineapple slices, peel, core and join to make a ring, then cut 4 long, thick pineapple strips.;2. Arrange fruit pieces and berries on a platter as shown.;3. Fill pineapple ring with yoghurt and serve platter.;Tip: Peel oranges and remove as much of the white pith as possible. Slice crossways then cut slices in half.;Nutritional Information;Per serve: 4g protein, 6g fat (1g sat fat), 29g carb, 14g sugars, 6g dietary fibre, 185mg sodium, 825kJ (195 cals)

ingredients: 3 kiwifruit, sliced;1 small pineapple, sliced;Cord or string;6 strawberries, hulled, halved;125g blueberries
methods: 1. Using shaped cutters, cut kiwifruit and pineapple.;2. Cut lengths of cord or string to about 80cm long. Using a skewer, make a hole through fruit and thread onto cord in order of preference.;NOTE: We used flower and star cutters. A heart shape cutter was used for the pineapple, to represent the jewel in Moana’s necklace.;TIP: These fruit shapes are great when added to lunchboxes. Pop some red grapes in for an even fruitier mix.;NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION;Per necklace: 1g protein, 0.5g fat (0g sat fat), 10g carb, 10g sugars, 3g dietary fibre, 0mg sodium, 225kJ (55 cals)

ingredients: 6 multigrain rolls;5 light tasty cheese slices;6 small lettuce leaves;2 medium tomatoes;6 slices of ham;2 medium Lebanese cucumbers, sliced;6 cherry tomatoes
methods: 1. Cut lightning bolts from 2 cheese slices, and halve remaining slices.;2. Split bread rolls. Top bases with lettuce, tomato, ham and cucumber, then sandwich with tops.;3. Attach remaining slices of cucumber for wheels, a piece of cheese for the lightning bolt, and cherry tomatoes for the spoiler.;NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION;Per serve: 32g protein, 11g fat (6g sat fat), 43g carb, 9g sugars, 6g dietary fibre, 605mg sodium, 1725kJ (410 cals)

ingredients: 2 cup peas;1/2 cup (40g) grated Parmesan;1/4 cup (60ml) extra virgin olive oil;1/4 cup chopped basil, plus extra leaves to garnish;1/4 cup lemon juice;2 tsp lemon zest;1 garlic clove, halved;400g spaghetti
methods: 1. Cook peas in a medium saucepan of boiling, salted water for 2-3 mins if frozen, or 4-5 mins if fresh, until tender. Drain. Place half of peas, Parmesan, oil, basil, lemon juice, lemon zest and garlic in a food processor. Pulse until puréed.;2. Meanwhile, cook spaghetti in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water according to packet directions. Drain and return to pan.;3. Add pesto and remaining peas to spaghetti. Toss on low heat for 1 min, until warmed through.;4. Divide between serving bowls.;5. Top with extra basil leaves and serve immediately.;Nutritional Information;Per serve: 5g protein, 5g fat (1g sat fat), 18g carb, 2g sugars, 24mg sodium, 579kJ

ingredients: 1 cup wholemeal or buckwheat pasta spirals;½ cup orange kumara, grated;½ cup beans, chopped into 2cm pieces;1 Smiling Tums Chicken & Vegetables pouch;½ cup parmesan, grated
methods: 1. In a medium pot, bring lightly salted water to the boil. Cook the pasta as per packet instructions. When there is five minutes cook time remaining, add the kumara and beans. Drain once cooked.;2. Add the Smiling Tums pouch and half the parmesan and mix together.;3. Serve garnished with the remaining parmesan.;PER SERVE;Energy 1132Kj • Protein 14g • Total Fat 7g • Saturated Fat 4g • Carbohydrates 36g • Sugars 7g • Sodium 160mg
